446.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
446.name: H.P.W. Cocktail

197.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, vermouth, Benedictine, and bitters. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
197.name: Cabaret

11.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain contents into a cocktail glass. Drop in a twist of lemon and serve.
11.name: Alaska Cocktail

194.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, Dubonnet, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
194.name: Bushranger #1

203.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
203.name: Caleigh

181.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
181.name: Bronx Silver Cocktail

525.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
525.name: Kiss-In-The-Dark

4.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
4.name: Adam

165.instructions: Pour brandy into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, add the twist of lemon peel, stir gently, and serve. (Ginger ale may be substituted for carbonated water, if preferred.)
165.name: Brandy Highball

407.instructions: Stir powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and add gin. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lemon peel and the orange spiral so that the end of the orange spiral dangles over rim of glass.
407.name: Gin Cooler

309.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon and cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the lemon slice, top with the cherry, and serve.
309.name: Diplomat

565.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Top with the cherry and serve.
565.name: Mai Tai

594.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, triple sec, and bitters. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the orange slice.
594.name: McDuff

602.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
602.name: Miami Beach Cocktail

612.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
612.name: Miss Belle

79.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
79.name: Beadlestone Cocktail

898.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
898.name: Tempter Cocktail

929.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
929.name: Tropical Cocktail

884.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
884.name: Sugar Daddy

1043.instructions: Build over ice in a highball glass.
1043.name: Sammensurium (Mix up)

928.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
928.name: Turf Cocktail

1088.instructions: Heat the cream and milk with the cinnamon and vanilla bean very slowly for 15-20 minutes. (If you don't have any beans add 1-2 tsp of vanilla after heating). Remove the bean and cinnamon. Add the chocolate. Mix until fully melted. Serve topped with some very dense fresh whipped cream. Serves 1-2 depending upon how much of a glutton you are. For a richer chocolate, use 4 oz of milk, 4 oz of cream, 4 oz of chocolate. Serve in coffee mug.
1088.name: Drinking Chocolate

892.instructions: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Stir well and serve.
892.name: T.N.T. No. 2

1152.instructions: If you use the whole all spice and cloves, tie them in cheesecloth. Heat the mixture. Stir occasionally. If you want an alcoholic drink, rum would be nice.
1152.name: Apple Cider Punch #1

1139.instructions: Boil water. Add cofee. Add sugar. Simmer, 20 min. Remove from heat, add chocolate. Alow to cool. Add vodka (or don't cool if you want some of the alcohol to boil off).
1139.name: Kahlua #3

1166.instructions: Make strong tea with 8 teabags and 4 cups of boiling water. Add cranberry juice, apple cider, brown sugar, and spices. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Garnish with orange slices. Serve.
1166.name: Cranberry Tea Hot Punch

1069.instructions: Put it all in a blender and pour over crushed ice. You can also use other fruits like strawberries and bananas.
1069.name: Lassi - Mango

1197.instructions: Take a bunch of grape juice and a bunch of fizzy stuff (club soda, ginger ale, lemonlime, whatever). Mix them in a punch bowl. Take orange sherbet and lime sherbet. Scoop out scoops and float them in the punch, let them melt a little so that a nasty film spreads all over the top of the punch but there are still "bubbles" in it in the form of sherbet scoops. Looks horrible, tastes just fine.
1197.name: Holloween Punch

1203.instructions: In a mug put sugar, butter, rum and cloves. Fill with boiling water. Stir.
1203.name: Hot-Buttered Rum

925.instructions: Pour the rum, vermouth, amaretto, and ginger ale into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon twist.
925.name: Triad

748.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cola) with ice and strain into a chilled collins glass. Fill with cola and serve.
748.name: Royal Fizz

897.instructions: Shake blended whiskey, Dubonnet, triple sec, and anis with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twists of orange and lemon peel and serve.
897.name: Temptation Cocktail

1007.instructions: Wash the cranberries and put them into a nonreactive saucepan with the water, a pinch of salt and if you wish, the orange slices. Cook over medium heat until all the berries burst -- about 10 minutes. Pour the fruit and liquid into a cheesecloth-lined sieve. Strain the juice to the saucepan, add the sugar and boil for two or three minutes. Taste and add more sugar if it is needed. Cool and chill the juice before serving.
1007.name: Cranberry Juice Cocktail

1114.instructions: Steep wormwood in vodka for 48 hours. Remove, add the rest and steep for one week. Age.
1114.name: Absinthe #1

1179.instructions: Separate the eggs. In an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until thick and lemon colored. Slowly add the bourbon and cognac, while beating at slow speed. Chill several hours. Add the salt to the egg whites and beat until almost stiff, or until the beaten whites form a peak that bends slightly. Whip the cream until stiff. Fold the whipped cream into the yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. When ready to serve, sprinkle the top with freshly grated nutmeg.
1179.name: Eggnog - Spiked

1093.instructions: Mix with a bit of milk (1 oz or so) in coffee mug. Nuke mug for about 30-50 seconds. Stir until the heated cocoa dissolves. Fill mug with milk. Nuke for 1-2 minutes, depending on wattage and preferences as to burnt mouth parts.
1093.name: Nuked Hot Chocolate

835.instructions: Pour sloe gin and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Drop the wedge of lime in glass and serve.
835.name: Sloe Gin Rickey

951.instructions: Shake vodka, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Decorate with slices of orange, lemon, and top with the cherry. Serve with a straw.
951.name: Vodka Collins

896.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, vermouth, and Benedictine. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lemon twist.
896.name: Tartantula

1010.instructions: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler, add grenadine syrup and grapefruit juice, top up with soda water. Stir a little and serve with a drinking straw.
1010.name: Grapefruit Lemonade

922.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
922.name: Top Banana

989.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
989.name: Will Rogers

834.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
834.name: Sloe Gin Flip

1031.instructions: Pour grenadine syrup over some ice cubes in a large tumbler. Stir. Fill up with cold milk. Stir again, serve with a drinking straw.
1031.name: Parisette

1132.instructions: Blend all ingredients in a blender for no longer than 2 mins. Pour over ice and enjoy straight away.
1132.name: Irish Cream - Bailey's #2

1084.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up. Note: Use lots of ice in this one - great on hot days! To add ice: Remove the center of the cover while the blender is on - drop 3 or 4 ice cubs and blend until they're completely crushed.
1084.name: Yoghurt Cooler

927.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
927.name: Trinity Cocktail

1212.instructions: Remove rind and core form pineapple, coarsely chop fruit. Combine pineapple, brandy and sugar, marinate 6 hours or overnight. Pour pineapple juice into a ring mold and freeze. Add wine to pineapple-brandy mixture, refrigerate 30 minutes. Add pineapple juice ring and champagne just before serving.
1212.name: Monarchy Luau Punch

952.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
952.name: Vodka Gimlet

956.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
956.name: Vodka Stinger

1135.instructions: Place all ingredients in a blender, blend well. Bottle and let mellow in refrigerator at least one week befor serving. this has been found to be best after 1-2 weeks. Store in refrigerator. Liqueur at room temperature by removing form refrigerator 1-2 hours before serving.
1135.name: Irish Cream Liqueur #2

934.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except champagne) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill glass with chilled champagne, stir lightly, and serve.
934.name: Typhoon

1162.instructions: This makes a colorful as well as refreshing drink if the liquids are not mixed together. Pour the lemonade over crushed ice, then add the red wine. Garnish with a sprig of mint and a cherry. Good for hot days.
1162.name: Chowning's Tavern Wine Cooler

1096.instructions: Mix Galliano and Absolut Citron in a shot glass, lay lemon wedge sprinkled with sugar over glass and pour a rum over wedge and glass. light rum with a lighter and let burn for a second. Do shot quickly and suck on lemon. If it is done correctly, this will taste like a shot of sweet lemonade.
1096.name: Lemon Shot

1189.instructions: Mix wine and spices, and heat it under cover some minutes on low heat - DO NOT BOIL. Add sugar, lemon peel and stir. Keep on heat and covered for a few more minutes. Serve with raisins and almonds. (You have to throw the almonds in boiling water for maybe a minute, and peel of the brown 'coating'. They should be white for use with glogg.) Serve in irish coffee cup.
1189.name: Glogg - Grandfather's

1181.instructions: Just mix all the liquids together, and float the sherbert in the punch just before serving.
1181.name: Fruit and Sherbet Punch

878.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
878.name: Strawberry Daiquiri

1033.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1033.name: Pineapple Power

1195.instructions: Serve in a hollowed out pumpkin with floating pumpkin chunks.
1195.name: Great Pumpkin Punch

1117.instructions: Combine all herbs, nuts and spices with vodka in a 1 quart or larger aging container. Cap tightly and shake daily for 2 weeks. Strain through a fine muslin cloth or coffee filter, discarding solids. Clean out aging container. Place liquid back in container. Place sugar and water in saucepan and stir to combine over medium heat. When sugar is completely dissolved, set aside and let cool. When cool combine with food coloring and add to liqueur liquid. Cap and allow to age and mellow in a cool, dark place for one month.
1117.name: Angelica Liqueur

1138.instructions: Simmer water, sugar, and coffee until the sugar dissolves. Put vanilla bean and bourbon in a gallon jug and add the coffee syrup you just prepared. Cover and let sit one month.
1138.name: Kahlua #2

1112.instructions: Prepare a pot of coffee at a good European strength. In the ground coffee, add 2 or 3 freshly ground cardamom pods. Sweeten while hot, then cool quickly. Serve in highball glass over ice, with cream. To get the layered effect, place a spoon atop the coffee and pour the milk carefully into the spoon so that it floats on the top of the coffee.
1112.name: Thai Iced Coffee

1185.instructions: Mix all ingredients, except for the lemonslices, in a coffee mug. Heat it (using a lid) on full power for 5-6 minutes or, if you are using a temperature meter, 75'C. Stir, until the sugar is dissolved. Serve in a small cup, with a slice of lemon for decoration.
1185.name: Glogg in the Microwave

848.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a brandy snifter, and serve. (The English translation of the name of this drink is 'Sun and Shade', and after sampling this drink, you'll understand why. Thanks, Kirby.)
848.name: Sol Y Sombra

809.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
809.name: Sevilla Cocktail #2

1095.instructions: Stir the milk with the chocolate and the cinnamon over low heat until the chocolate dissolves. Add the eggs and beat the mixture until it becomes thick, taking care not to boil. Serve in coffee mug.
1095.name: Spanish chocolate

1126.instructions: Wash leaves in cold water several times. Shake or pat dry gently. Snip each leaf in half or thirds. Discard stems. measure cut mint leaves, packing lightly. Combine mint leaves and vodka in aging container. Cap and let stand in a cool place for 2 weeks, shaking occasionally. After initial aging, strain leaves from liqueur, discard leaves. In a sucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Let cool. Add cooled syrup to liqueur base, stirring to combine. Add glycerine and food color, pour into aging container for secondary aging of 1-3 more months.
1126.name: Fresh Mint Liqueur

865.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
865.name: St. Patrick's Day

742.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip into powdered sugar. Shake vermouth, gin, brandy, lemon juice, and grenadine with ice, strain into the sugar-rimmed glass, and serve.
742.name: Rose Cocktail (English)

955.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of water and juice of lemon. Add vodka. Pour into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes and stir. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
955.name: Vodka Sling

1035.instructions: Mix sugar syrup with lemon juice in a tall glass. Fill up with ginger ale.
1035.name: Rail Splitter

1094.instructions: Combine all ingredients in heavy medium saucepan. Stir over low heat until chocolate melts. Increase heat and bring just to a boil, stirring often. Remove from heat and whisk untily frothy. Return to heat and bring to boil again. Remove from heat, whisk until frothy. Repeat heating and whisking once again. Discard orange peel. (Can be prepared 2 hours ahead. Let stand at room temperature. Before serving, bring just to boil, remove from heat and whisk until frothy.) Pour hot chocolate into coffee mugs. Makes 2 servings.
1094.name: Orange Scented Hot Chocolate

757.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
757.name: Rum Daisy

747.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
747.name: Royal Cocktail

728.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
728.name: Reform Cocktail

1021.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1021.name: Orangatang

1119.instructions: Combine coffee, sugar and water. Simmer 1 hour and let cool. Add vanilla and vodka. Age in sealed jar 2 to 3 weeks.
1119.name: Coffee Liqueur

1130.instructions: Mix scotch and milk. Add half-and-half. Add rest.
1130.name: Irish Cream

975.instructions: Pour blended whiskey into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
975.name: Whiskey Highball

963.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
963.name: Webster Cocktail

787.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
787.name: Scotch Bird Flyer

793.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, egg, sugar, and cream. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the nutmeg.
793.name: Scotch Flip

1056.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1056.name: Fruit Flip-Flop

1146.instructions: Wash plums and pat dry. Cut plums in half or smaller, pit. Place plums in aging container. Pour sugar over plums, stir. Add vodka and brandy stirring to partly disolve sugar. Cap container and place in a cool, dark place for 2 months, stir occasionally. Place a strainer over large bowl and strain liqueur. Press liquid from plums with the back of a wooden spoon. Discard plum pulp. Re-strain liqueur through cloth until clear. Bottle as desired. Ready for drinking or cooking but best if aged another month.
1146.name: Plum Liqueur

977.instructions: Pour blended whiskey and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Drop the wedge of lime in glass and serve.
977.name: Whiskey Rickey

899.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, triple sec, and bitters. Stir well. Pour the Curacao into the center of the drink.
899.name: Ten Quidder

823.instructions: In a mixng glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and Scotch. Stir well. Strain into a shot glass. Carnish with the lemon twist.
823.name: Silver Bullet #1

919.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
919.name: Tipperary Cocktail

950.instructions: Pour vodka into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with tonic water, stir, and serve.
950.name: Vodka And Tonic

966.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
966.name: Wembly Cocktail

948.instructions: Pour vodka and juice of lime into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Drop the lime wedge in glass and fill with lemon-lime soda. Stir well and serve.
948.name: Vodka "7"

830.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
830.name: Sitarski

1001.instructions: Shake well, strain into a large cocktail glass.
1001.name: Alice Cocktail

1022.instructions: Stir orange juice and lemon juice with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into a cocktail glass.
1022.name: Lemon Cocktail

1068.instructions: Put all ingredients into a blender and blend until nice and frothy. Serve chilled.
1068.name: Lassi - Sweet

959.instructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, grenadine, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a red wine glass filled with cracked ice. Add the orange slice, top with the cherry, and serve with a straw.
959.name: Ward Eight

1100.instructions: Lots of ice and soda top up in tall glass with cherry and a grin.
1100.name: Surf City Lifesaver

1098.instructions: Mix and fill up with soda water. Drunk by finns on a sunny day any time of the year and day.
1098.name: Autodafe

1045.instructions: Combine the crushed ginger,lime peel,juice and sugar in a jar or bottle larger than 32 oz with a lid that can be tightly sealed. Pour in the boiling water. Cover loosely and let cool to room temp. Dissolve the yeast in the lukewarm water and add. Seal the jar as tightly as possible and let stand at room temp overnight. Chill, strain and serve.
1045.name: Homemade Ginger Beer

987.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
987.name: Widow Woods' Nightcap

832.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
832.name: Sloe Gin Cocktail

937.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
937.name: Valencia Cocktail

770.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
770.name: Russian Cocktail

958.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
958.name: Wallick Cocktail

1023.instructions: Stir lemon juice and orange juice in a mixing glass, strain into a large cocktail glass.
1023.name: Orange Cocktail

1037.instructions: Mix with ice, serve. "Oranges and lemons say the bells of St. Clement's"
1037.name: St. Clement's

1184.instructions: Of course in Norway most people just buy an extract. Anyway, this makes a pretty nice Glogg: Add cloves, cardamon pods, cinnamon, and citrus peel to a glass with a generous measure of snaps (akvavit) or vodka. Let sit for a day or so. This makes a cery nice extract that can be added to any decent red wine. Just heat up the wine slowly (dont let it boil!!), and add sugar and extract to taste.
1184.name: Glogg Extract

905.instructions: Shake tequila, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
905.name: Tequila Sour

1005.instructions: Shake well and strain into a large cocktail glass.
1005.name: Bobby Cocktail

1155.instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a large punch bowl with a block of ice. If found too dry, sugar syrup may be added. Decorate with twists of lemon peel.
1155.name: Artillery Punch

861.instructions: Shake brandy, gin, orange juice, and bitters with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel, top with the cherry, and serve.
861.name: Spencer Cocktail

808.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
808.name: Sevilla Cocktail

1042.instructions: Shake or build directly in the glass.
1042.name: Tropical

1062.instructions: Add allspice, clove and cinnamon stick to the apple cider and let simmer for 1 hour (or longer). This may not look like much spice, but it really does make a pleasantly spicey cider.
1062.name: Hot Spiced Cider #1

746.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a whiskey sour glass, and serve.
746.name: Royal Clover Club Cocktail

765.instructions: Stir powdered sugar, water, and bitters in an old-fashioned glass. When sugar has dissolved add ice cubes and light rum. Add the twist of lime peel, float 151 proof rum on top, and serve.
765.name: Rum Old-fashioned

805.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
805.name: September Morning

1178.instructions: Whip egg substitute and sugar together, combine with the two kinds of milk, vanilla, and rum. Mix well. Chill over night. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 6 servings.
1178.name: Egg Nog - Healthy

1188.instructions: Stir half a bottle of the wine with the spicesand sugar under heating, close to boiling. Remove casserolee from heat. Set aside for 24 hours. Strain off spices, and add remaining wine, vodka, and sherry. Add appx. 10 dashed aromatic tincture (this is a spice concentrate). Bottle your glogg, seal well, and let mature for a week. Mix with red wine or water, heat and serve in irish coffee cup.
1188.name: Glogg - Christmas

1206.instructions: Pour red wine and blue curacao in a punsch glass and fill up with boiling water. Garnish with orange slice.
1206.name: Lady's Punsch

997.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except banana slice) with ice and strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass. Garnish with the banana slice and serve.
997.name: Yellow Strawberry

972.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinke nutmeg on top and serve.
972.name: Whiskey Eggnog

1082.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1082.name: Sweet Bananas

1106.instructions: Mix together in a coffee mug and chill before serving.
1106.name: Iced Coffee Fillip

1073.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
1073.name: Imperial Cocktail

985.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
985.name: White Way Cocktail

906.instructions: Pour tequila into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with orange juice and stir well. Top with blackberry brandy and stir lightly. Add the cherry on top and serve.
906.name: Tequila Sunset

1041.instructions: Shake or blend very well, serve icecold in a burgundy glass. If you wish to garnish, use grapes.
1041.name: Grape Flip

1124.instructions: Bring sugar and water to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Cool. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let ripen for 1 month.
1124.name: Creme de Menthe

1032.instructions: Mix juice and sugar syrup in a large tumbler with several ice cubes. Stir well and top up with cold Soda Water. Serve with a drinking straw.
1032.name: Pineapple Lemonade

1151.instructions: Add 1/4 cup water to ginger root. Boil 3 minutes. Strain. Add the liquid to the guava, lemon and pineapple juices. Make a syrup of sugar and remaining water. Cool. Combine with juices and pineapple. Chill throroughly.
1151.name: Aloha Fruit punch

1182.instructions: Make up the kool-aid ahead of time, by dissolving in a small amount on water (as little as possible). Don't add sugar! Cool this mixture. With everything cold, mix it all together, just before the party. You can add sherbert to keep it cold, or make ice cubes, or an ice cube ring, using the kool-aid mixture. You probably won't need to add any sure to this, as the soda, lemondade, and pineapple juice should contain plenty.
1182.name: Fruit Punch

1107.instructions: Bring 2 cups of water to boil. Add all the ingredients and boil again for about 15 seconds. Let stand for a minute. Warm milk in a pot. Filter tea into cups. Add milk and sugar. That's IT.
1107.name: Masala Chai

912.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
912.name: Third-Rail Cocktail

1047.instructions: Blend very well, preferably in a household mixer. Serve in a wine glass, garnish with whipped cream and a piece of banana.
1047.name: Banana Milk Shake

727.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
727.name: Redcoat

921.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass alomst filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir and garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
921.name: Tom Collins

1105.instructions: Mix together until coffee and sugar is dissolved. Add milk. Shake well. Using a blender or milk shake maker produces a very foamy drink. Serve in coffee mug.
1105.name: Iced Coffee

841.instructions: Pour sloe gin into a highball glass filled with ice. Fill with orange juice, stir well, and serve.
841.name: Slow Screw

953.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
953.name: Vodka Grasshopper

1186.instructions: Pour the wine & vodka into a large pot. Add spices, fruit and nuts. Turn on the heat and bring the ingredients to a temperature just below the boil. Now for the fun part. Invite all of your guests into the kitchen. Place the sugar cubes in a sieve (one that you don't mind sacrificing to the greater good). Don oven mitts and set the glogg on fire. Ladle the burning glogg over the sugar cubes until it has all melted. I usually do this with the overhead lights off for greater theatrics. When the sugar is melted, cover the pot to extinguish the flame. Ladle glogg, fruit and nuts into irish coffe cups and serve.
1186.name: Glogg #1

1140.instructions: Mix first 4 ingredients and simmer them for 1.5-2 hours with occasional stirring. Cool. Add the rest of the stuff. Filter and pour into dark bottles. Keep the bottles in a cool, dark place for 3 months. Shake every day.
1140.name: Kahlua #4

982.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
982.name: White Lily Cocktail

1055.instructions: Toss strawberries with sugar, and let sit overnight in refrigerator. Cut lemon, reserve two slices. Juice the rest. Mix together the lemon juice, strawberries, apple juice, and soda water. Add slices of lemon (decor, really). In glasses, put ice cubes, and a slice of apple. Pour drink in, and serve.
1055.name: Fruit Cooler

1012.instructions: Blend all ingredients in a food processer or mixer and store in the fridge or freezer. To make a drink add a shot of good dark rum along with 1 or 2 tbl spoons of batter to a mug of very hot water. Serve in irish coffee cup.
1012.name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter #2

968.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass and serve.
968.name: What The Hell

1216.instructions: In 2-quart suacepan combine sugar, brown sugar and butter. Cook over low hear, stirring occasionally, until butter is melted (6-8 min). In large mixing bowl, combine cooked mixture with ice-cream, beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often until smooth (1-2 min). Store refrigerated up to 2 weeks or frozen up to one month. For each serving, fill mug with 1/4 cup mixture, 1 oz. rum and 3/4 cup boiling water, sprinkle with nutmeg.
1216.name: Old Fashioned Hot Buttered Rum

1122.instructions: In blender container, combine all ingredients, blend until smooth. Serve over ice if desired. Store tightly covered in refrigerator up to one month. Stir before using.
1122.name: Cream Cordial

1192.instructions: Boil sugar and spices in water, leave in the water for 30 minutes. Strain the spiced water and mix with the wine. Heat slowly until short of boiling temperature. (To remove alcohol, let it boil for a while.) You may add lemon or orange juice to taste. Serve in irish coffee cup.
1192.name: Gluehwein

1061.instructions: Dump cider, cinnamon sticks and a couple of teaspoons of nutmeg into a pot over very low heat. Slice oranges (after washing them well!!), and stick whole cloves into the rind, then float in cider as it warms. That's it. Drink when it gets warm. You can dump more cider into it up to a point when the spices get old - then just start again with a new set of spices, and a new orange.
1061.name: Hot Mulled Cider #1

1008.instructions: Add ice. Tastes remarkably like a screwdriver.
1008.name: End Wrench

901.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except ginger ale) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale, stir, and serve.
901.name: Tequila Fizz

1207.instructions: Mix Lemonade in very large punch bowl. Add soda and frozen fruit. Open sherbet and dump the entire package of it into punch (it will float on the top). Due to the frozen fruit and Sherbet, there is really no need for ice until later, or unless it it very hot.
1207.name: Lemon Sherbert Punch

886.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the orange slice, top with a cherry, and serve.
886.name: Surf Rider

1115.instructions: Mix together and let sit a few days. Strain through a coffee filter. To serve mix 1 part absinthe to 4 parts water, add ice, enjoy.
1115.name: Absinthe #2

852.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
852.name: Soother Cocktail

1164.instructions: Boil the cinnamon sticks in the water. Take the sticks out when the water is yellow and has the smell and taste of cinnamon. Add the evaporated milk, condensed milk and egg yolks and cook at low temperature. While it's cooking stir to avoid it sticking to the bottom of the pot. When it is boiling for a few minutes, add the cream of coconut and rum. Stir well and take off the burner. Let it cool and it will be ready. Keep it in the refrigerator and it will last for a very long time.
1164.name: Coquito

870.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
870.name: Stinger

965.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
965.name: Weep-No-More Cocktail

887.instructions: Pour the rum, peach schnapps, and orange juice into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the orange slice.
887.name: Surrey Slider

1080.instructions: Juice ginger and lemon and add it to hot water. You may add cardomom.
1080.name: Kill the cold Smoothie

784.instructions: Pour Ricard into a glass and swirl around to coat glass, discard any excess. Place the sugar, Peychaud bitters, and water int othe glass and muddle with the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes. Pour the bourbon over the ice cubes.
784.name: Sazerac

1123.instructions: Dissolve coffee in water. Mix all ingredient's slowly in a blender. Serve chilled. Keeps, sealed in the fridge, for 2 weeks.
1123.name: Creamy Rum Liqueur

741.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
741.name: Rory O'more

755.instructions: Shake rum, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
755.name: Rum Collins

863.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
863.name: Spring Feeling Cocktail

879.instructions: Blend all ingredients (except mint sprig) with 1 cup of crushed ice in an electric blender at a high speed. Pour into a cocktail glass, add the sprig of mint, and serve.
879.name: Strawberry Dawn

1168.instructions: Separate the eggs (yolk and white) Set the white aside. Mix yolks well, gradually adding the cream, milk, and sugar. Get back to the egg white - WHIP IT (whip it good!) until "soft peaks" form. Fold the white into the rest. Gradually add the alcohol. Either add nutmeg right away, or sprinkle on top later. AGE for at least 2 hours in refridgerator, uncovered.
1168.name: Egg Nog - Williamsburg

1053.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1053.name: Earth Shake

797.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, muddle the bitters and water into the sugar cube, using the back of a teaspoon. Almost fill the glass with ice cubes and add the scotch. Garnish with the orange slice and the cherry. Serve with a swizzle stick.
797.name: Scotch Old-Fashioned

721.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
721.name: Red Apple

1090.instructions: Combine sugar and cocoa, add milk and a dash of salt. Makes 8 servings. For 1 serving place 1/3 cup dry mixture in a coffee mug, add boiling water and stir.
1090.name: Hot Chocolate #1

837.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
837.name: Sloeberry Cocktail

882.instructions: Let the hot chocolate cool to room temperature. In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, creme de cacao, and hot chocolate. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Drop the cream into the center of the drink.
882.name: Sue Riding High

827.instructions: Pour grenadine, gin, and sweet and sour into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir well. Fill with carbonated water and top with cherry brandy. Add the cherry on top and serve.
827.name: Singapore Sling

1067.instructions: Blend the yoghurt and ice cubes together, until the yoghurt becomes more liquid. Add sugar to taste. The lemon/lime is optional but it gives it a slightly tart taste. Dash of salt. Raita is also good for the summer. Instead of having a traditional salad you can make raita instead.
1067.name: Lassi Raita

1131.instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a blender. Blend on lowest setting until frothy or well blended.
1131.name: Irish Cream - Bailey's #1

1147.instructions: Combine all ingreds in aging container. Cover tightly and shake gently several times during the first 24 hrs. After 24 hrs, remove the lemon zest. Cover again and let stand in a cool, dark place for 2 weeks, shaking gently every other day. Strain through a wire sieve to remove the angelica root and fennel. Return to aging container, cover and let stand undisturbed in a cool dark place for 6 months. Siphon or pour clear liqueur into a sterile bottle. The cloudy dregs may be saved for cooking.
1147.name: Scottish Highland Liqueur

745.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin and Chambord. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
745.name: Rouge Martini

1218.instructions: Mix ingredients together, freeze to slush consistency and serve "slushy".
1218.name: Party Slush Punch #1

1018.instructions: In electric blender, blend on high for a few seconds, until leaves are reduced. Strain into silver tumbler packed with shaved ice, add more Bourbon to saturate the ice, garnish with a sprig of mint.
1018.name: Mint Julep #3

960.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
960.name: Warsaw Cocktail

779.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
779.name: Santiago Cocktail

839.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
839.name: Sloppy Joe's Cocktail No. 2

1044.instructions: Shake vodka, Pisang and sour mix well with ice. Pour into a highball glass. Fill with soda water.
1044.name: Ishav

1029.instructions: Place some ice cubes in a large tumbler or highball glass, add lemon juice, orange juice, sugar syrup, and stir well. Top up with cold soda water, serve with a drinking straw.
1029.name: Orangeade

851.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
851.name: Sonny Gets Kissed

1052.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1052.name: Dutch Treat

998.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
998.name: Yolanda

761.instructions: Pour the rum and Rose's lime juice into a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the lime wedge.
761.name: Rum Gimlet

1193.instructions: This is essentially a hot eggnog. You beat an egg, add a tablespoon of honey and a jigger of whisky. Pour this into a irish coffe cup and then fill the glass with warm milk and stir until it's well mixed.
1193.name: Gogl-Mogl

893.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve. (An olive may be substituted for the cherry, if preferred.)
893.name: Tailspin Cocktail

794.instructions: Pour scotch in a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
794.name: Scotch Highball

880.instructions: Pour brandy and schnapps over ice in a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Garnish with a strawberry and serve.
880.name: Strawberry Fields Forever

945.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
945.name: Victor

1208.instructions: In a pitcher, dissolve the sugar in the apple juice. Add lemon juice, wine, pineapple and apple in chunks. Mix. Add ginger ale and ice right before serving.
1208.name: Light Sangria with Pineapple

916.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
916.name: Thunder-And-Lightning

849.instructions: Pour brandy into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Float cream on top and serve.
849.name: Sombrero

986.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
986.name: Why Not?

990.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve.
990.name: Woo Woo

1103.instructions: Pour Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum over ice, fill glass to top with Ginger Ale. Garnish with lime. Tastes like a cream soda. Named for the Gilligan's Island reference ("The Captain" *in* "Ginger" is a Happy Skipper!)
1103.name: Happy Skipper

1196.instructions: Mix champagne and frozen cranberry juice (undeluted). Slice lime and garnish each wine glass. Serve with breakfast to start the day right. Note: Mix right before serving to retain the bubbles. Yo may use non-alcoholic champagne.
1196.name: Holiday Cheer

792.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the sugar, lemon juice, and water. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with crushed ice. Add the Scotch. Stir well and garnish with the cherry and the lemon slice.
792.name: Scotch Fix

1137.instructions: Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour. let cool and add vanilla and either a pint or fifth of Vodka. Drink and Enjoy!!
1137.name: Kahlua #1

814.instructions: Shake sherry, powdered sugar, and egg with ice and strain into a collins glass. Fill with milk and stir. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
814.name: Sherry Eggnog

881.instructions: Rub rim of cocktail glass with lemon juice and dip rim in salt. Shake schnapps, tequila, triple sec, lemon juice, and strawberries with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass, and serve.
881.name: Strawberry Margarita

891.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
891.name: Swiss Family Cocktail

874.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a chilled whiskey sour glass, and serve.
874.name: Stone Sour

1176.instructions: In an electric mixer, beat the egg yolks with the sugar until thick and lemon colored. Slowly add the bourbon and cognac, while beating at a slow speed. Chill several hours. Add the salt to the egg whites and beat until almost stiff, or until the beaten whites form a peak that bends slightly. Whip the cream until stiff. Fold the whipped cream intothe yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. When ready to serve, sprinkle the top with freshly grated nutmeg. Serve in punch bowl. If desired, add one or two cups of milk to the yolk mixture for a thinner eggnog.
1176.name: Egg Nog #5

1058.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1058.name: Grapple

936.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
936.name: Union Jack Cocktail

1039.instructions: Build in a highball glass. Add ginger ale over ice and sprinkle grenadine syrup over it. Garnish with a lemon slice and a cherry.
1039.name: Shirley Temple

754.instructions: In an old-fashioned glass, dissolve the sugar in the club soda. Add crushed ice until the glass is almost full. Add the rum. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry and the orange and lemon slices.
754.name: Rum Cobbler

864.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except port) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Top with port, add the slice of lemon, and serve.
864.name: St. Charles Punch

1091.instructions: Mix milk, cocoa, sugar and coffemate. For 1 serving place 1/3 cup dry mixture in coffee mug, add boiling water and stir.
1091.name: Hot Chocolate #2

790.instructions: Pour scotch and creme de menthe over ice cubes in a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
790.name: Scotch Cooler

1213.instructions: Mix juice and Kool-Aid, add 1 gallon water, stir and watch it turn green!
1213.name: Monster Slime Juice

786.instructions: Pour the Scotch and the water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
786.name: Scotch And Water

1204.instructions: Fill a tall glass with ice. Pour in rum and tia maria. Add pineapple juice.
1204.name: Jamaica Me Crazy

1157.instructions: Boil water and sugar for 5 minutes. Cool and add the remaining ingredients except ginger ale. Freeze. Remove from freezer 2 to 3 hours before serving. Mix with ginger ale. Float assorted fruit in punch bowl. Vodka could also be added.
1157.name: Banana Punch #2

804.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except mint sprigs) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprigs of mint and serve.
804.name: Sensation Cocktail

924.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
924.name: Tovarich Cocktail

1026.instructions: Shake egg, grenadine syrup, orange juice, and several ice cubes well. Strain into a small tumbler, serve with a drinking straw.
1026.name: Orange Smile

1040.instructions: Stir in a mixing glass Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, tomato juice, and a little salt and pepper over ice cubes. Strain off into a large cocktail glass.
1040.name: Tomato Cocktail

750.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
750.name: Royal Smile Cocktail

847.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
847.name: Snyder

1116.instructions: Combine sugar and 3/4 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until all sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool. In an aging container, combine apricot halves, almond extract, grain alcohol with 1/2 cup water, and brandy. Stir in cooled sugar syrup mixture. Cap and let age for 2 days. Remove apricot halves. (Save apricot halves, can be used for cooking). Add food coloring and glycerine. Stir, recap and continue aging for 1 to 2 months. Re-bottle as desired. Liqueur is ready to serve but will continue to improve with additional aging.
1116.name: Amaretto Liqueur

1015.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1015.name: Honey Lemonade

778.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
778.name: Sandra Buys A Dog

932.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
932.name: Twin Hills

971.instructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Decorate with slices of orange, lemon, and top with the cherry. Serve with a straw.
971.name: Whiskey Collins

729.instructions: Put powdered sugar and 2 oz. carbonated water into a collins glass and stir. Add ice cubes and gin, fill with carbonated water, and stir again. Add the twist of lemon peel and the spiral of orange so that the end dangles over rim of glass.
729.name: Remsen Cooler

854.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lime slice) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Add the slice of lime and serve.
854.name: South Of The Border

801.instructions: Put 3 ice cubes into a highball glass. Pour in vodka. Fill balance of glass with orange juice, stir, and serve.
801.name: Screwdriver

856.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
856.name: Southern Bride

776.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktial glass.
776.name: Sand-Grown-Un

980.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
980.name: White Heart

1003.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1003.name: Berry-Berry

1175.instructions: In a small mixer bowl beat egg yolks till blended. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating at high speed till thick and lemon colored. Stir in milk, stir in rum, bourbon, vanilla, and salt. Chill thoroughly. Whip cream. Wash beaters well. In a large mixer bowl beat egg whites till soft peaks form. Gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold yolk mixture and whipped cream into egg whites. Serve immediately. Sprinkle nutmeg over each serving. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl. NOTE: For a non-alcoholic eggnog, prepare Eggnog as above, except omit the bourbon and rum and increase the milk to 3 cups.
1175.name: Egg Nog #4

1038.instructions: Remove strings from rhubarb, wash, and cut into 1/2" pieces. Wrap rhubarb in cheesecloth and tie shut. Bring sugar and water to boil. Put cheesecloth in the syrup and simmer over medium heat for 30 minutes or until it thickens. Remove cheesecloth, squeeze it to get the juice out. Pour syrup into a clean, dry bottle and cork tightly. To mix add 1 part syrup to 3 parts water and add 2 ice cubes per person. Serve well chilled.
1038.name: Rhubarb Syrup

992.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
992.name: X.Y.Z. Cocktail

840.instructions: Pour sloe gin and Southern Comfort into a collins glass filled with ice. Fill with orange juice, stir well, and serve.
840.name: Slow Comfortable Screw

820.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
820.name: Silent Broadsider

732.instructions: Fill champagne flute with chilled champagne. Add blue curacao, amaretto, and lemon juice. Stir, add the twist of lemon, and serve.
732.name: Ritz Fizz

722.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the bourbon, Cointreau, lemon juice, and egg white. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass and garnish with the orange slice.
722.name: Rebel Yell

813.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
813.name: Shanghai Cocktail

907.instructions: Stir tequila, vermouth, and bitters with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel, top with the olive, and serve.
907.name: Tequini

1154.instructions: Pour over ice in a hurricane class. Float dark rum on top and serve.
1154.name: Voodoo Juice

862.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
862.name: Sphinx Cocktail

796.instructions: Pack a collins glass with crushed ice. Pour in scotch. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve with a straw.
796.name: Scotch Mist

1111.instructions: Place the coffee and spices in the filter cone of your coffee maker. Brew coffee as usual, let it cool. In a tall glass, dissolve 1 or 2 teaspoons of sugar in an ounce of the coffee (it's easier to dissolve than if you put it right over ice). Add 5-6 ice cubes and pour coffee to within about 1 inch of the top of the glass. Rest a spoon on top of the coffee and slowly pour whipping cream into the spoon. This will make the cream float on top of the coffee rather than dispersing into it right away.
1111.name: Thai Coffee

913.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
913.name: Three Miller Cocktail

1077.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
1077.name: Kiwi Papaya Smoothie

973.instructions: Shake juice of lemon and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add blended whiskey and stir. Add the slice of lemon and serve with a straw.
973.name: Whiskey Fix

890.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
890.name: Sweet Patootie Cocktail

763.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum and vermouth. Stir well. Strain into a cocktial glass. Garnish with the lemon twist or an olive.
763.name: Rum Martini

1006.instructions: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass on the rocks. Garnish with 1 slice of pineapple and one cherry.
1006.name: Bora Bora

1078.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
1078.name: Mango Orange Smoothie

942.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
942.name: Vesuvio

1102.instructions: Put a copper coin in a coffe-cup and fill up with coffee until you no longer see the coin, then add alcohol until you see the coin. Norwegian speciality.
1102.name: Karsk

1177.instructions: In large saucepan, beat together eggs, sugar and salt, if desired. Stir in 2 cups of the milk. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick enough to coat a metal spoon and reaches 160 degrees F. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 2 cups milk and vanilla. Cover and regfigerate until thoroughly chilled, several hours or overnight. Just before serving, pour into bowl or pitcher. Garnish or add stir-ins, if desired. Choose 1 or several of: Chocolate curls, cinnamon sticks, extracts of flavorings, flavored brandy or liqueur, fruit juice or nectar, ground nutmeg, maraschino cherries, orange slices, peppermint sticks or candy canes, plain brandy, run or whiskey, sherbet or ice-cream, whipping cream, whipped. Serve immediately.
1177.name: Egg-Nog - Classic Cooked

1028.instructions: Shake cream, pineapple juice and orange juice with some ice. Strain into a large cocktail glass.
1028.name: Orange Velvet

1065.instructions: Blend in a blender for 3 seconds. Lassi is one of the easiest things to make, and there are many ways of making it. Basically, it is buttermilk (yoghurt whisked with water), and you can choose almost any consistency that you like, from the thinnest to the thickest. Serve cold.
1065.name: Lassi - A South Indian Drink

1011.instructions: Blend all ingredients in a food processer or mixer and store in the fridge or freezer. To make a drink add a shot of good dark rum along with 1 or 2 tbl spoons of batter to a mug of very hot water. Serve in irish coffee cup.
1011.name: Hot Buttered Rum Batter #1

1200.instructions: In 2 qt. microproof casserole, combine hot water, sugar, spices, and concentrated juices. Stir, then cook on HI 5-6 minutes or until mixture boils. Heat rum in microproof container on HI for 30 seconds. Ignite and pour over hot beverage. Ladle into punch cups for serving.
1200.name: Hot Devilish Daiquiri

775.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
775.name: San Francisco Cocktail

1017.instructions: Squeeze the juice of the lemon into a 10-oz. glass. Add maple syrup and a dash of cayenne pepper. Fill with ice water. Stir. Drink.
1017.name: Hot Lemonade

760.instructions: Stir juice of lemon, powdered sugar, and water in a highball glass. Fill glass with ice, add rum, and stir. Add the slice of lemon and serve with a straw.
760.name: Rum Fix

1209.instructions: Combine orange juice, lilikoi syrup and guava syrup, blend well. Chill. Serve over ice cubes.
1209.name: Malihini Punch

911.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
911.name: The Shoot

1092.instructions: Combine sugar, cocoa, salt and hot water in 1-quart micro-proof measuring cup (or coffee mug). Microwave at HIGH (100%) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or until boiling. Add milk, sitr and microwave an additonal 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until hot. Stir in vanilla, blend well.
1092.name: Microwave Hot Cocoa

723.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine the gin and Cherry Heering. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the cherry.
723.name: Red Gin

1141.instructions: Use fifteen 12 oz bottles with tops (cork is prefered with liquor bottles). Make sure the bottles are clean. Mix the coffee, sugar, vanilla poweder in the largest bowl you have. Add the boiling water and make sure all of the ingredients are blended well. Let cool to room tempature and then add the brandy (make sure that you give it time to cool so you don't cook down the brandy). Get a funnel and bottle your Kahlua immediately. Let stand for a couple of days. Enjoy!!!!
1141.name: Kahlua #5

752.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
752.name: Ruby Fizz

774.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice cubes in a highball glass. Stir well and serve. (Vodka may be substituted for gin, if preferred.)
774.name: Salty Dog

817.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
817.name: Shriner Cocktail

1016.instructions: Prepare in a blender or shaker, serve in a highball glass with 2-3 ice cubes. Garnish with one orange slice, and one lemon slice. Use only fresh squeezed juice for best result!
1016.name: Lucky Driver

1170.instructions: Beat egg yolks until thick and lemon yellow, then beat in 1 cup sugar. Add slowly the rye, rum and peach liquer. Beat until smooth. Add the milk and half-and-half. Beat the egg whites until stiff but not dry, gradually adding 1/2 cup of confectioners sugar. Fold the egg whites into the batter. Just before serving, whip the cream and fold it into the other ingredients. Garnish with ground nutmeg. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl.
1170.name: Egg Nog - Katie's

1215.instructions: Mix with ice in a Tupperware dish pan. Serve in 16 oz glasses (with caution). Tastes great, but can lead to wastedness if comsumed too quickly, hence the name NULL & VOID punch.
1215.name: Null & Void Punch

1171.instructions: Allow ice-cream to soften. Mix all of the ingredients together and refrigerate. Serve with ground nutmeg sprinkled on top. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl
1171.name: Egg Nog Ice-Cream

842.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old fashioned glass alomst filed with crushed ice.
842.name: Sly Goes To Havana

909.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
909.name: The Bronx Ain't So Sweet

967.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
967.name: Western Rose

1142.instructions: Put the slices of rye-bread in the oven (200 degrees Celsius) for about 45 mins, until they're dried. Boil the 8 liters of water. Crumble the dried rye-bread, put it in the boiling water for about 5 mins. Let it the water, and rye-bread rest for 4 hours, covered with a tea-cloth. Crumble the yeast, 15 mins before the 4 hours are over. Mix the crumbled yeast with some sugar and the luke warm water. Let it rest for 15 mins. Filter the water-rye-bread mix in a kitchensieve. Carefully extract all water from the rye-bread. Wash, and peel the lemon. Add the lemon-peel, the sugar, the yeast and the mint. Stir the solution, and let it rest (covered) for 8 hours. Sieve the solution (tea-cloth). Bottle it. Put some raisins, a bit of lemon-peel, and a fresh leaf of mint in every bottle, close the bottles, and keep them in a cool place. Ready when the raisins start floating. Sieve the stuff one more time in a tea-cloth. Put the Kvas in the fridge 4 hours before drinking.
1142.name: Kvas

1019.instructions: Prepare in a blender with a little ice, serve in a highball glass.
1019.name: Kanaan

789.instructions: Pour scotch, brandy, and curacao over ice in an old-fashioned glass. Add the orange slice, top with the mint sprig, and serve.
789.name: Scotch Cobbler

1205.instructions: Shake and strain. Add a few drops of grenadine. Garnish with a slice of lime, a maraschino cherry and fresh mint.
1205.name: Sud-Ouest

1161.instructions: Mix sugar, brandy and 5 bottles champagne in a punch bowl. Then stir in orange, lemon and lime sliced thin into rounds, pineapple chunks and ice. Stir until well mixed. To complete, garnish with strawberries and pour a final bottle of champagne theatrically over the top.
1161.name: Champagne Punch #2

772.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
772.name: Rye Whiskey Cocktail

876.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, vermouth, Calvados, and cherry brandy. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the cherry.
876.name: Stranger-In-Town

988.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
988.name: Widow's Kiss

1173.instructions: Separate 6 eggs. Beat yolks well. Beat in 1/2 cup sugar. Clean/degrease beaters and bowl. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beat in 1/2 cup sugar. Fold in yolks to whites. Gently stir in 1 pt heavy cream, 1 pt milk, 1 pt bourbon, and 1 oz rum. Serve as is or well chilled. Double recipe to fill a punch bowl.
1173.name: Egg Nog #2

940.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
940.name: Verboten

1143.instructions: Spread the yeast on a piece of bread. Boil the water, honey and sugar. Stand in an earthenware pot. Skim off anyscum. Add lemon juice, cloves and ginger. Leave to cool. When just warm, float the bread and yeast on the top. Cover with a clean cloth. Leave for about 6-8 days. Strain and bottle. Corks should be loose to start with. Leave for at least 5-6 months.
1143.name: Medd

836.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
836.name: Sloe Vermouth

812.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except olive) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the olive and serve.
812.name: Shamrock

1101.instructions: Served over ice. Sounds nasty, but tastes great.
1101.name: Grizzly Bear

1002.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1002.name: Apple Karate

821.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cinnamon) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle cinnamon on top and serve.
821.name: Silk Stockings

939.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
939.name: Velvet Hammer #1

1156.instructions: Mix it up varying the ingredients to taste. Balance the Orange and Pineapple, add a little Malibu rum till you can slightly taste the coconut, then enough Campari to redden it and then make up the rest with rum. A delicious and authentic island drink that will make you very drunk if you aren't careful ('cuz its so good to drink!).
1156.name: Bahamas Rum Punch

781.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
781.name: Saucy Sue Cocktail

1202.instructions: Combine the cider, sugar and spices in a large saucepan. Heat slowly to boiling. Boil 3-5 minutes. remove spices. Serve hot garnished with orange slices, lemon slices, or rings of unpared red apple with whole cloves forced through peel. 16 servings. If desired, chill spiced cider and serve over ice cubes made from apple juice.
1202.name: Hot Spiced Cider #2

1165.instructions: Combine first four ingredients. Stir until sugar is dissolved, chill. Then add ginger ale just before serving. Add ice ring to keep punch cold.
1165.name: Cranberry Punch

816.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
816.name: Sherry Milk Punch

871.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
871.name: Stirrup Cup

888.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
888.name: Susan Littler

806.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, brandy, vermouth, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with the lemon twist.
806.name: Serpentine

926.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
926.name: Trilby Cocktail

855.instructions: Pour the brandy into a pousse cafe glass. Tilt the glass to a 45-degree angle and slowly pour the creme de cacao down the side of the glass so that it floats on the brandy. Repeat this precedure with the Benedictine.
855.name: Southern Belle

1127.instructions: Boil water, corn syrup and sugar for 5 minutes. Add the remaining ingredients and stir. Cover and let stand 1 month.
1127.name: Galliano

1054.instructions: Mix syrup and milk in a fountain glass. Add soda water, serve with a straw.
1054.name: Egg Cream

941.instructions: Stir vermouth and creme de cassis in a highball glass with ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir again, and serve.
941.name: Vermouth Cassis

769.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in water in an old-fashioned glass. Add rum and one ice cube and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
769.name: Rum Toddy

1148.instructions: Boil water, sugar and coffe for 10 mins and let cool. Add rum and vanilla. Put in clean bottle(s) and leave for 1 week before using.
1148.name: Tia-Maria

829.instructions: Pour the rum, lemon juice, grenadine, and tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
829.name: Sister Starseeker

915.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
915.name: Thunder

1087.instructions: Melt the bar in a small amount of boiling water. Add milk. Cook over low heat, whipping gently (with a whisk, i would assume) until heated well. Don't let it boil! Serve in coffee mug.
1087.name: Chocolate Drink

1081.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1081.name: Strawberry Shivers

1064.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1064.name: Just a Moonmint

810.instructions: Pour melon liqueur, tequila, and grapefruit juice over ice in a highball glass and stir. Add the slice of lime, top with the cherry, and serve.
810.name: Shady Lady

758.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
758.name: Rum Dubonnet

904.instructions: Mix sugar, bitters, and 1 tsp. water in an old-fashioned glass. Add tequila, ice cubes, and carbonated water. Add the stick of pineapple and serve.
904.name: Tequila Old-Fashioned

1014.instructions: Mix lemon juice with sugar syrup in a highball glass, stir well and fill up with soda water. Serve with drinking straw.
1014.name: Lemon Squash

1071.instructions: Juice the lemons. Peel and grate the ginger. Place the grated ginger and a liberal dash of the cayenne pepper into a piece of cheesecloth, and tie it into a knot. Let soak in the water. After 15 minutes or so, add the sugar, and the lemon juice. Chill, and serve.
1071.name: Lemouroudji

768.instructions: Dissolve powdered sugar in mixture of 2 oz. carbonated water and juice of lime in a collins glass. Fill glass with ice and stir. Add bitters and rum. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve with a swizzle stick.
768.name: Rum Swizzle

1118.instructions: Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the oranges (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups vodka. Close jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until the vodka has absorbed the flavor. Remove peel and add remaining vodka. Close jar and add remaining cup of vodka. Close the jar and store in a cool dark place at least 1 month to age.
1118.name: Caribbean Orange Liqueur

846.instructions: Pour Kahlua and light cream into a highball glass filled with ice and stir well. Fill with carbonated water, stir lightly, and serve.
846.name: Smith And Kearns

1198.instructions: Take a Cooler and throw a bag of ice in it. Add beer, white liquor and frozen Lemon-Lime Daqueri mix. Stir until Daqueri mix has liquified. Enjoy.
1198.name: Hop Skip and Go Naked Punch

782.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
782.name: Savannah

738.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
738.name: Rolls-Royce

1180.instructions: Separate eggs. Beat yolks, add sugar. Add bourbon slowly while beating. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold whites into egg yolk mixture, then fold whipped cream into mixture. Refrigerate for more than 4 days. Stir frequently to avoid separation. Color will change to a pale Serve with nutmeg or cinnamon.
1180.name: Eggnog - "Kentucky-style"

739.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the root beer. Stir well. Garnish with the cherry.
739.name: Root Beer Fizz

780.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
780.name: Saratoga Cocktail

1159.instructions: Combine Orange Kool-Aid and Vodka. Add some Jagermeister and it will look and taste scary.
1159.name: Boo Punch

788.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
788.name: Scotch Bishop Cocktail

895.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine lime juice, sugar, Scotch, and bitters. Shake well. Almost fill a collins glass with crushed ice. Stir until glass is frosted. Strain mixture in shaker into the glass and add the club soda.
895.name: Tartan Swizzle

974.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
974.name: Whiskey Flip

1004.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1004.name: Black & Blue Berries

1191.instructions: Put cardamon seeds, cinnamon, cloves and orange parts in nylon bag and tie top. In large saucepan put bag, half bottle of the wine, and the raisins. Cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Add remaining wine and the almond, heat through. In another saucepan warm about 1/3 of the brandy (or aquavit), pour in sugar and light with match to flame. When sugar has melted, pour in the remainder of brandy. If necessary extinguish flame with cover lid. Add sugar mixture to wine mixture. Pour in cups with raisins and almonds in each serving. Serve in irish coffee cup. A hot cup of glogg is the Scandinavian way of offering a warm welcome to a friend on a wintery evening.
1191.name: Glogg - Swedish

1153.instructions: Make sure ingreadients are well chilled. Cut unpeeled apples 1cm cubes. Combine fruit and mint with apple juice in large punch bowl. Mix well, cover and refrigerate until serving. Before serving add chilled apple cider and lemonade.
1153.name: Apple Cider Punch #2

996.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cocktail onion) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the cocktail onion and serve.
996.name: Yellow Rattler

777.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
777.name: Sand-Martin Cocktail

917.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
917.name: Thunderclap

979.instructions: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice.
979.name: Whisky Mac

1211.instructions: Combine all but ginger ale and ice. Chill. Add ginger ale and ice before serving.
1211.name: Mock Pink Champagne #2

873.instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice cubes. Add whiskey and bitters and fill with apple cider. Both Bourbon and Scotch can be used.
873.name: Stone Fence

1030.instructions: Mix lemon juice and orgeat syrup in a tumbler with 2-3 small ice cubes. Fill up with soda water and stir.
1030.name: Orgeat Lemonade

1199.instructions: Crush cranberry sauce with a fork. Mix with sugar, spices and salt. Add water and pineapple juice. Cover and simmer 2 hours. Ladle into mugs and float a pat of butter in each serving.
1199.name: Hot Buttered Cranberry Punch

908.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
908.name: Thanksgiving Special

1144.instructions: Heat water in medium saucepan. when hot add coffee and stir until dissolved. Add sugar and vanilla bean, stirring well to combine. Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Imediately reduce heat so that a very low boil is maintained for one minute. Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm. Pour vodka and brandy into aging container. Add the cooled coffee mixture and the chocolate extract. Stir well. Cap and let age in a cool dark place for 3 weeks. After initial aging, strain liqueur through a cloth-lined wire-mesh strainer over a large bowl. Repeat until desired clairity is reached. Stir in food coloring. Bottle, cap and let age an additional 1-3 months.
1144.name: Mexican Coffee Liqueur

931.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with crushed ice, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
931.name: Twenty Thousand Leagues

730.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
730.name: Resolute Cocktail

1076.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
1076.name: Grape lemon pineapple Smoothie

983.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
983.name: White Lion Cocktail

1036.instructions: Shake very well pineapple juice, raspberry fruit-syrup and cream with ice cubes. Strain into a large cocktail glass.
1036.name: Rose de Mai Cocktail

1219.instructions: Put the ingredients into a container in the freezer (stir occasionally while freezing). To serve: put 2/3 slush to 1/3 7-up in each glass or same ratio in punch bowl.
1219.name: Party Slush Punch #2

783.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
783.name: Saxon Cocktail

838.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
838.name: Sloppy Joe's Cocktail No. 1

961.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
961.name: Washington Cocktail

995.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
995.name: Yale Cocktail

833.instructions: Shake sloe gin and juice of lemon with ice and strain into a collins glass. Add several ice cubes, fill with carbonated water, and stir. Add slices of lemon and orange, top with the cherry, and serve with a straw.
833.name: Sloe Gin Collins

1089.instructions: Melt the chocolate, butter and vanilla in a double boiler. When just smooth stir in the cream.
1089.name: Hot Chocolate to Die for

877.instructions: Place schnapps, half-and-half, sugar, and 2 cups of crushed ice in an electric blender and blend at a high speed. Add 2 of the strawberries and blend for 10 seconds. Pour into a parfait glass, top with the other strawberry, and serve with a straw.
877.name: Strawberries And Cream

1072.instructions: In a large glass, put the lime juice and sugar, and stir well. Add cold seltzer water to fill. Put the lime peels in the glass. Drink. Repeat until limes or soda run out.
1072.name: Limeade

1049.instructions: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.
1049.name: Banana Strawberry Shake Daiquiri-type

954.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a highball glass over ice cubes, stir well, and serve.
954.name: Vodka Salty Dog

993.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
993.name: Xanthia Cocktail

1149.instructions: Combine sugars and water. Boil for 5 minutes. Gradually stir in coffee. Cool. Add vodka and vanilla and mix thoroughly. Cover and let ripen for 1 month. Remove vanilla bean.
1149.name: Vanilla-Coffee Liqueur

1108.instructions: Brew espresso. In a coffee mug, place 1 teaspoon of unsweetened powdered cocoa, then cover a teaspoon with honey and drizzle it into the cup. Stir while the coffee brews, this is the fun part. The cocoa seems to coat the honey without mixing, so you get a dusty, sticky mass that looks as though it will never mix. Then all at once, presto! It looks like dark chocolate sauce. Pour hot espresso over the honey, stirring to dissolve. Serve with cream.
1108.name: Melya

1163.instructions: Mix all liquids in a large punch bowl. Float the sherbet on top.
1163.name: Cold Duck Punch

1063.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1063.name: Jungle Juice #2

1070.instructions: In a large cooking pot (at least twice the size needed to contain your soy milk), mix everything together and heat on high while stirring constantly. Bring to a boil (remember to stir constantly!), and the concoction will froth up. Remove from heat, let the froth subside, and repeat this cycle three more times. This is why your pot has to be bigger: the frothing would cause a major spill if you used a smaller pot. Serve and drink while hot. You can also adjust sweetness in your cup. Some people may want to strain this, as the ground spices sometimes have some coarse particles. This is a very nice hot drink, with a definite indian-food flavour, spicy-sweet and rich. The original recipe using milk also called for a tablespoon of butter for each serving (yuk!), and that was intended to make the drink rich-tasting. The thicker soy milk already has that thick rich texture, and is much lower in fat content.
1070.name: Vegan - Hot indian "milk" drink

994.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
994.name: Xeres Cocktail

1214.instructions: Simmer 3 cups water with, sugar, cloves, cinnamon sticks, and lemon peel in a stainless steel pot for 10 minutes. Add wine heat to a "coffee temperature" (DO NOT BOIL) then add the brandy.
1214.name: Mulled Wine
