1201.instructions: In a large saucepan combine apple cider/juice, brown sugar, and nutmeg. for spice bag, place cinnamon, allspice, and the 1 teaspoon cloves in cheesecloth and tie, add to cider mixture. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 10 minutes. Remove spice bag and discard. Serve cider in mugs with a clove-studded orange wedge in each.
1201.name: Hot Mulled Cider #2

736.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
736.name: Rock And Rye Cocktail

1060.instructions: Stud the oranges with cloves. (Push the pointy end into them until the flower part is flush with the peel.) I use about 10 per orange. You may want to peel the top layer of skin off the orange if you don't want to ingest the dyes they put on them to make them orange. Put the cider into a large saucepan, and add the oranges and some cinnamon sticks (one or two will do). Heat for hours (you can just leave it on all day for a party). It gets better with age. Just pour in more cider when it starts getting low.
1060.name: Hot Cider

1013.instructions: Put several ice cubes in a shaker, add egg yolk, sugar syrup and lemon juice. Shake very well and strain into a highball glass. Serve with a drinking straw.
1013.name: Lemon Flip

903.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a champagne flute, and serve.
903.name: Tequila Matador

822.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass.
822.name: Silver Bronx

845.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
845.name: Smiler Cocktail

1051.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.

1020.instructions: The proportions are approximate, vary according to taste. Mix together, serve with lots of ice.

938.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, and serve.
938.name: Van Vleet

1133.instructions: Blend all ingredients in a blender until mixed well, serve cold. Stores up to two weeks in the fridge, but it's never lasted that long :-).
1133.name: Irish Cream - Bailey's #3

825.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.

749.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except carbonated water) with ice and strain into a highball glass over two ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
749.name: Royal Gin Fizz

914.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.

999.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except 151 proof rum) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Float the 151 proof rum on top, add a cherry (if desired), and serve.

1034.instructions: Shake or blend briefly, strain into a highball glass. Garnish with fresh fruit, cherry, and a drinking straw.

771.instructions: Pour the Scotch and Drambuie into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Garnish with the lemon twist.

910.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Benedictine, and chery brandy. Stir well. Strain into a colliins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with the club soda and stir well.
910.name: The Original Singapore Sling

1079.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
1079.name: Pineapple Gingerale Smoothie

883.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
883.name: Suffragette City

991.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
991.name: Woodward Cocktail

1050.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1050.name: Cool Cow

853.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
853.name: Soul Kiss Cocktail

946.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into a collins glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
946.name: Victory Collins

1009.instructions: Mix and stir with ice in a mixing glass, strain off into a large cocktail glass.
1009.name: Grapefruit and Orange Cocktail

1097.instructions: Half fill with cranberry juice and grapefruit juice, stir in highball glass.
1097.name: Sex on the Beach

762.instructions: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
762.name: Rum Highball

735.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
735.name: Robson Cocktail

759.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
759.name: Rum Eggnog

815.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
815.name: Sherry Flip

828.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
828.name: Sir Walter Cocktail

850.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
850.name: Son Of Adam

981.instructions: In a shaker half-filler with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
981.name: White Lady

740.instructions: Pour vodka, galliano, and light cream into a collins glass filled with ice cubes and stir well. Fill with cola, stir lightly, top with whipped cream, and serve.
740.name: Root Beer Float

1048.instructions: Blend all together in a blender until smooth.
1048.name: Banana Strawberry Shake

900.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
900.name: Tequila Cocktail

1086.instructions: Boil milk in the top of a deep double boiler five minutes. Remove from fire and add chocolate, mixed with the cinnamon, a little at a time, beating with molinillo or egg beater after each addition. When the chocolate is thoroughly blended, heat to the boiling point. Place over bottom of double boiler and add eggs, whipping constantly, until they are thoroughly blended and the mixture is frothing. Serve in coffee mug. Serves eight.
1086.name: Chocolate Beverage

753.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
753.name: Ruby In The Rough

920.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
920.name: To Hell With Swords And Garter

1099.instructions: Shake well and serve in a cocktail glass. This is a home cocktail of American/Internet Bar del Pozzo, Pavia, Italy.
1099.name: Gagliardo

1104.instructions: Mix together. Blend at highest blender speed for about 1 minute. Pour into a glass and drink with a straw. Notes: This works best if everything is cold (if you make fresh coffee, mix it with the milk and let it sit in the fridge for 1/2 hour. If it is not frothy, add more milk, or even just some more milk powder. The froth gradually turns to liquid at the bottom of the glass, so you will find that you can sit and drink this for about 1/2 hour, with more iced coffee continually appearing at the bottom. Very refreshing.
1104.name: Frapp

731.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
731.name: Riley's Sparrow

1083.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1083.name: Tomato Tang

799.instructions: Shake scotch, juice of lime, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with 1/2 slice lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
799.name: Scotch Sour

1027.instructions: Put one ice cube in a large tumbler, add lemon juice and orange juice. Stir well. Serve sugar and cold water on the side, so the guest can modify the taste, and a drinking straw and a spoon.
1027.name: Orange Squash

1059.instructions: Place all ingredients in the blender jar - cover and whiz on medium speed until well blended. Pour in one tall, 2 medium or 3 small glasses and drink up.
1059.name: Great Grapes

872.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
872.name: Stone Cocktail

1066.instructions: Blend (frappe) in blender until frothy. Add torn curry leaves and serve cold.
1066.name: Lassi Khara

1167.instructions: Mix kahlua with eggnog in a wine glass and then sprinkle some nutmeg on top.
1167.name: Egg Nog - Kahlua

1220.instructions: Mix the following ingredients together and freeze. When slushy, drink as is or mix with 7-UP.
1220.name: Party Slush Punch #3

969.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
969.name: Whip Cocktail

1150.instructions: Split vanilla beans first lengthwise, then in 1/2 inch pieces. Put in a bottle, add brandy and sugar, and shake *very* well until the sugar has dissolved. Now leave the mixture about 1 month so that the vanilla flavour has time to develop properly. After one month you can strain the liqueur so that the vanilla particles are removed. The vanilla liqueur keeps a very long time. To serve you have two possibilities: either use the liqueur as it comes out of the bottle, or mix with half'n'half or whipping cream. The latter doesn't keep too long though, it should be used in the next days (or right now). You can also pour a small amount of the liqueur in a glass of milk as a kind of alcoholic vanilla milk.
1150.name: Vanilla Liqueur

1085.instructions: Shift the cocoa and sugar together into a medium-sized saucepan. Dissolve the cornstarch in the water, and stir into the cocoa and sugar until it is a smooth paste. Begin heating the mixture, stirring it with a whisk, and gradually pour in the milk. Continue stirring with the whisk as you bring the liquid to a simmer. Allow the chocolate to simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring often, until it is thick, glossy and completely smooth. Serve steaming hot in coffee mug. Serves six.
1085.name: Castillian Hot Chocolate

1160.instructions: Combine all of the ingredients and serve in punch cups.
1160.name: Champagne Punch #1

1172.instructions: Beat yolks until light in color. Slowly add bourbon, cognac, while beating at slow speed. Chill 3 hrs. Add salt to whites, beat to peaks. Whip s cream until stiff. Fold whipped cream into yolk mixture, then fold in the beaten egg whites. Chill one hour. Serve with nutmeg sprinkled on top. For thinner mixture add 1 or 2 cups of milk. Serve in a punch bowl or another big bowl.
1172.name: Egg Nog #1

725.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
725.name: Red Raider

1110.instructions: Incidentally, a pinch of cinnamon is indeed a nice addition to coffee but true heaven is a cardamom seed. Of course, you serve it in a coffee mug.
1110.name: Spiking coffee

724.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
724.name: Red Cloud

1190.instructions: Mix everything in a casserole. Keep overnight. Heat the mixture - do NOT boil. Strain and serve hot woth raisins and almonds. (You have to throw the almonds in boiling water for maybe a minute, and peel of the brown 'coating'. They should be white for use with glogg.) Serve in irish coffee cup.
1190.name: Glogg - Grandmother's

737.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
737.name: Rococo

818.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
818.name: Sidecar

894.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
894.name: Tango Cocktail

944.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes.
944.name: Vicious Sid

800.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Add the cherry on top and serve.
800.name: Screaming Banana Banshee

858.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
858.name: Soviet

1136.instructions: Blend (use blender) all ingredients until smooth. Store tightly covered in refrigerator. Shake before serving. Keeps up to one month.
1136.name: Irish Cream Liqueur #3

957.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
957.name: Waikiki Beachcomber

803.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into an Irish coffee glass filled with crushed ice. Stir well.
803.name: Secret Place

1194.instructions: Pour the concentrate and the apple juice into the punch bowl. Stir the ginger ale into the bowl. Spoon in sherbet or add an Ice Ring. Serve immediately.
1194.name: Golden Glow Punch

902.instructions: Shake tequila, vermouth, and lime juice with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange, top with the cherry, and serve.
902.name: Tequila Manhattan

866.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
866.name: Stanley Cocktail

962.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a collins glass over ice cubes, and serve.
962.name: Watermelon

1210.instructions: Boil sugar and water until sugar dissolves, cool. Stir cranberry, pineapple, orange juices. Chill. Just before serving, add carbonated beverage.
1210.name: Mock Pink Champagne #1

831.instructions: Pour gin and sweet and sour into a collins glass over ice cubes and stir well. Fill with chilled beer, stir lightly, and serve.
831.name: Skip And Go Naked

859.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
859.name: Spark In The Night

976.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
976.name: Whiskey Milk Punch

824.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
824.name: Silver Cocktail

744.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
744.name: Roselyn Cocktail

767.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the rum, lemon juice, and sugar. Shake well. Strain into a sour glass and garnish with the orange slice and the cherry.
767.name: Rum Sour

970.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
970.name: Whiskey Cocktail

867.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
867.name: Stanley Senior

935.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
935.name: Ulanda Cocktail

826.instructions: Shake gin and vanilla ice-cream with ice and strain into a highball glass. Fill with carbonated water, stir, and serve.
826.name: Silver Stallion Fizz

889.instructions: Shake all ingredients with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
889.name: Sweet Maria

726.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass.
726.name: Red Ruby

791.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the Scotch, lemon juice, sugar, and grenadine. Shake well. Pour into an old-fashioned glass. Garnish with the cherry and the orange slice.
791.name: Scotch Daisy

964.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
964.name: Wedding Belle Cocktail

978.instructions: Shake blended whiskey, juice of lemon, and powdered sugar with ice and strain into a whiskey sour glass. Decorate with the half-slice of lemon, top with the cherry, and serve.
978.name: Whiskey Sour

766.instructions: Pour rum into a highball glass over ice cubes. Add orange juice, stir, and serve.
766.name: Rum Screwdriver

1129.instructions: Dissolve honey in hot water. The water should not be hotter than 45 degrees Celsius. Let the mixture cool down, then add spirit of wine.
1129.name: Honey Liquor

1187.instructions: Combine all the non-alcoholic ingredients in a heavy enamel or stainless steel saucepan, bring to a boil and simmer 5 minutes. Add the red wine and the port and bring to a boil again. Remove from heat and let steep, covered, for at least 2 hours. Then bring back to a simmer, add the brandy, and heat for 1 minute. If you want to be fancy you can put it into a warmed metal bowl, turn down the lights and ignite it before serving. Serve in irish coffee cup.
1187.name: Glogg #2

751.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, lemon juice, Curacao, sugar, and egg. Shake well. Strain into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Add the club soda. Stir well.
751.name: Royalty Fizz

1183.instructions: Put the sherry, sugar, spices, and lemon juice into a large mixing bowl. Stir until well-blended, then leave to soak for at least half an hour. Beat the cream until it is stiff. Fold in the chopped ginger. Chill thoroughly. Before serving divide into four serving bowls and top with crumbs of crystallized ginger and a shake of nutmeg.
1183.name: Ginger Syllabub

918.instructions: Blend all ingredients in an electric blender at a low speed for a short length of time. Pour into a highball glass and serve.
918.name: Tidbit

1134.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Store in the refrigerator for up to one month.
1134.name: Irish Cream Liqueur #1

802.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except mint leaves) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Decorate with mint leaves and serve.
802.name: Seaboard

807.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except mint sprig) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the sprig of mint and serve.
807.name: Seventh Heaven Cocktail

868.instructions: Pour all of the ingredients into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
868.name: Starseeker

1125.instructions: Pare very thinly the bright-colored rind from the limes (no white). Blot the peel on paper towels to remove any excess oil. Put peel in a 4 cup screw-top jar. Add 2 cups of the rum. Close the jar. Store in a cool, dark place for 2 days or until rum has absorbed the flavor. Remove the peel and add the sugar. Shake vigorously until the sugar dissolves and add remaining cup of rum. Close jar and store in a cool, dark place at least 1 month to age.
1125.name: Daiquiri Liqueur

1113.instructions: Combine Thai tea (i.e., the powder), boiling water, and sweetened condensed milk, stir until blended. Pour into 2 tall glasses filled with ice cubes. Garnish with mint leaves. Makes 2 servings.
1113.name: Thai Iced Tea

843.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin, Benedictine, and orange juice. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the cherry.
843.name: Smart Christine

860.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
860.name: Special Rough Cocktail

923.instructions: Shake light rum, brandy, and cream with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Float 151 proof rum on top and serve.
923.name: Torridora Cocktail

773.instructions: In a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes, combine the gin or vodka with the sake. Stir well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with the olive.
773.name: Saketini

933.instructions: Pour vodka and juice of lime into a collins glass over several ice cubes. Fill with lemon-lime soda, stir, and serve.
933.name: Twister

844.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
844.name: Smile Cocktail

984.instructions: Pour vodka and coffee liqueur over ice cubes in an old-fashioned glass. Fill with light cream and serve.
984.name: White Russian

1174.instructions: Separate eggs and refrigerate the whites. Beat ylks until light in color. Gradually beat in sugar, then slowly beat in 1 cup of rum. Let stand covered for atleast 1 hr. Add rest of liquor, cream, and peack brandy, beating constantly. Refrigerate, covered, for 3 hours. Beat egg whites until stiff, fold in. Serve sprinkled with nutmeg. Serve in a punch bowl or another medium sized bowl.
1174.name: Egg Nog #3

1075.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and liquify.
1075.name: Apple Berry Smoothie

1128.instructions: Place zest and sugar in a small bowl. Mash and mix together with the back of a wooden spoon or a pestle. Continue mashing until sugar is absorbed into the orange zest and is no longer distinct. Place into aging container. Add cognac. Stir, cap and let age in a cool dark place 2 to 3 months, shaking monthly. After initial aging, pour through fine mesh strainer placed over medium bowl. Rinse out aging container. Pour glycerine into aging container and place cloth bag inside strainer. Pour liqueur through cloth bag. Stir with a wooden spoon to combine. Cap and age 3 more months before serving.
1128.name: Grand Orange-Cognac Liqueur

811.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except orange slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of orange and serve.
811.name: Shalom

1145.instructions: Crush pineapple pieces *very* finely. Put together with the pineapple juice in a pan, add the sugar. Leave to stand over night. Drain syrup and strain pineapple pieces through a cheese cloth or in a food processor. Mix juice with rum and vodka, add lemon juice to taste. Pour in a 0.7 l bottle and fill to the brim with pineapple juice or water. Leave at least one week.
1145.name: Pineapple Liqueur

949.instructions: Pour vodka into a highball glass over two or three ice cubes. Fill with apple juice, stir, and serve.
949.name: Vodka And Apple Juice

785.instructions: Shake all ingredients well with cracked ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
785.name: Scooter

1024.instructions: Put several ice cubes in a large tumbler, add sugar syrup and orange juice, top up with ginger ale. Stir.
1024.name: Orange Cooler

1121.instructions: Place the chopped cranberries in a 2 liter jar that has a tight-fitting lid. Add the sugar and rum. Adjust the lid securely and place the jar in a cool, dark place. Invert the jar and shake it every day for six weeks. Strain the cordial into bottles and seal with corks.
1121.name: Cranberry Cordial

795.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lemon slice) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add the slice of lemon and serve.
795.name: Scotch Holiday Sour

857.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except lemon peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of lemon peel and serve.
857.name: Southern Gin Cocktail

733.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
733.name: Rob Roy

1120.instructions: Boil water and sugar until dissolved. Turn off heat. Slowly add dry instant coffee and continue stirring. Add a chopped vanilla bean to the vodka, then combine the cooled sugar syrup and coffee solution with the vodka. Cover tightly and shake vigorously each day for 3 weeks. Strain and filter. Its also best to let the sugar mixture cool completely so the vodka won't evaporate when its added. If you like a smoother feel to the liqueur you can add about 1 teaspoon of glycerine to the finished product.
1120.name: Coffee-Vodka

1158.instructions: Add all ingredients to large bowl. Stir gently. Serve chilled.
1158.name: Berry Deadly

734.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
734.name: Robin's Nest

798.instructions: Pour scotch and juice of lime into a highball glass over ice cubes. Fill with carbonated water and stir. Add the lime peel/rind and serve.
798.name: Scotch Rickey

1074.instructions: Juice cantaloupe, pour juice into blender, add banana, and liquify.
1074.name: Banana Cantaloupe Smoothie

819.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
819.name: Sidecar Cocktail

1217.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
1217.name: Party Punch

947.instructions: Rub rim of old-fashioned glass with lemon juice and dip in salt. Shake all ingredients with ice, strain into the salt-rimmed glass over ice cubes, and serve.
947.name: Viva Villa

743.instructions: Stir all ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
743.name: Rose Cocktail (French)

764.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except nutmeg) with ice and strain into a collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.
764.name: Rum Milk Punch

930.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except cherry) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Top with the cherry and serve.
930.name: Tuxedo Cocktail

885.instructions: Stir all ingredients (except orange peel) with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Add the twist of orange peel and serve.
885.name: Sunshine Cocktail

869.instructions: Pour all ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes, stir, and serve. (Bourbon may be substituted for blended whiskey, if preferred.)
869.name: Stiletto

1046.instructions: Let tea steep for at about 5 mins so it's nice and strong. After tea is cool, mix together the remaining ingredients. Add more sugar and/or lemon juice to suit your taste. Some flavors may need more juice concentrate.
1046.name: Homemade Snapple

1109.instructions: First make tea in the water. Then add all the other stuff. Simmer at least 1/2 hour. Makes a nice smell in the kitchen at Christmas parties.
1109.name: Russian Tea #1

943.instructions: Pour the rum and cherry brandy into an old-fashioned glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well.
943.name: Veteran

756.instructions: Pour the rum and soda into a collins glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well and garnish with the lemon wedge.
756.name: Rum Cooler

875.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve.
875.name: Straight Law Cocktail

1169.instructions: Here's an egg nog recipe using cooked eggs, so no one has to be paranoid about salmonella. Mix granulated sugar, 2 Tbl. of water, and lemon juice in a med. sized sauce pan. Let boil, cook 5 min, until it turns dark amber. Remove from heat, and slowly stir in remaining 1/4 c. of water. Beat eggs and milk together in a bowl. Stir into sugar mixture, cook over med.-low heat for about 10 to 12 minutes. (It should thicken enough to stick to spoon) Poor into a clean bowl (punch bowl or something), stir in vanilla, nutmeg and salt. Refigerate, covered, until cold. Before serving, beat together cream, liquer, adn 10x sugar, until soft peaks form. Pour chilled eggnog into a serving bowl, fold in whipped cream with a whisk.
1169.name: Egg Nog - Cooked

1614.instructions: Use about 1:4 of creme de menthe to club soda, and stir.
1614.name: Cold Shower

1434.instructions: Fill 12 oz. glass with ice. Add all the alcohol and sour mix. Top off glass with Coca-Cola to taste then watch out.
1434.name: Long Island Iced Tea #2

1428.instructions: Blend vodka, lime and sugar, top with soda water, serve in a higball glass.
1428.name: Russian funk

1488.instructions: In a shot glass pour the Yukon Jack to just below the rim. Add Goldschlager, filling the glass to full. Enjoy.
1488.name: Yukon Cornelius

1548.instructions: Fill cup with ice. Pour Pusser's Rum to fill about 1/4 of the glass. Fill with an equal amount of Cream of Coconut (Coco Lopez is good. Add some pineapple juice and a good splash of orange juice. Shake well. Add cherry and sprinkly nutmeg. Grab a staw and get ready! This was originally made in the Britsh Virgin Islands -- Pussers is the official rum of the Royal British Navy. Alter the amount of rum to your taste. Sorry about the inexact measurements -- that's the way we do it down in de islans mon!
1548.name: Pain Killer

1410.instructions: Add 1 oz. vodka in a glass, then add 1 oz. of Root-beer snapes mix with Root-beer add one scoop of ice-cream at top of the glass.Enjoy.
1410.name: Slacker's Slammer

1504.instructions: Stirred, best without the rocks. Tastes just like the real thing
1504.name: Robitussin

1308.instructions: Mix with cracked ice in a shaker. Serve in a chilled highball glass
1308.name: Mudslide #1

1667.instructions: Serve on ice or blend for a milk shake effect.
1667.name: Chocolate Raspberry Delight

1538.instructions: Heat vine, add raisines and boiled. Mix Coca-Cola, tequila, orange juice and add to boiled vine with raisines. Toss bananas with hot red pepper flakes. Pour Don Perignon over bananas. Mix everything thougether and store in a glass jar. Put in a fridge for 8 hours. Served chilled with fresh cherries. Enjoy !!!
1538.name: Hina Blast

1547.instructions: Blend alcohol with ice-cream. Serve in frosted glass.
1547.name: Frozen Mudslide

1268.instructions: Shake well (preferably in a closed container). Stir (preferably with a spoon in an opened container)
1268.name: Bullfrog

1331.instructions: Pour ingredients into 1 ounce shot glass
1331.name: Big Red

1508.instructions: Serve with two ice-cubes. You can vary the amount of Coca-Cola, all after how soft you want the drink to be.
1508.name: All American

1719.instructions: Half fill shaker with ice. Add liquers and top with milk. Shake and pour over ice.
1719.name: Chocolate Chip

1338.instructions: Throw em all together and stir
1338.name: Patmcpacke

1530.instructions: Pour tequila in a highball glass with ice, and top with orange juice. Stir. Add grenadine by tilting glass and pouring grenadine down side by flipping the bottle vertically very quickly. The grenadine should go straight to the bottom and then rise up slowly through the drink. Garnish stirrer, straw and cherry-orange.
1530.name: Tequila Sunrise

1561.instructions: pour into a shot glass and present to consumer, they are expected to cover the top of the shotglass with thier palm, raise the glass, slam it on the bar and the swallow quickly.
1561.name: Apple Slammer

1672.instructions: Mix all ingredients together in a blender or mix in a bowl with a whisk until fully blended.
1672.name: Irish Cream, Home Made

1627.instructions: Put 4 or 5 ice cubes in a large old-fashioned glass and fill 3/4 full with Clamato juice. (Clamato may be mixed 1/2 and 1/2 with any other favorite tomato or veggie juice). Add the vodka, Worcestershire, Tabasco, and Horseradish and stir thoroughly with a spoon or swizzle. Twist the lime slice over the glass edge and stick a scallion in as a casual stirrer and delicious finish to the drink.
1627.name: Don's Bloody Mary

1556.instructions: Fill a 16 oz pint glass with ice, pour the above in. Garnish with cherries.
1556.name: Watermelon Crawl

1342.instructions: Put in all alcohol first and water last, then salt
1342.name: Instant Death

1716.instructions: Add equal parts of liqeuer to hot chocolate or cocoa and top with whipped cream and shave chocolate, cinnamon or nutmeg.
1716.name: Spicey Scot

1600.instructions: Mix 1 part warm Cointreau and 1 part Vodka into a tumbler with a cube of sugar. Stir until sugar is disolved.
1600.name: French Sailor

1521.instructions: mix together in large container....stir in the alcohol from atart of list till the halls....for melted halls centers do the following...: use a needle and thread and put it through each halls..tie a knot after each one...place in 1 to 2 litres of boiling..and i mean boiling hot water until all are melted pour into bowl and mix in the water and raspberry juice. have fun should serve 10 to 20 people at 1 litre each we use this for our residence house drink ..it is safe and actually very tastey..try it and see.
1521.name: Red Death (MAC style)

1688.instructions: First: Mix pina colada with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice(set aside). Second: Mix daiquiri with 2.5 oz. of rum with ice. Third: While frozen, add pina colda mix then daiquiri mix in glass (Making sure they do not get mixed together).
1688.name: Miami Vice

1613.instructions: Squeeze lime wedge over ice Pour rum, juice, & cola Stir lightly Add club soda or tonic to taste
1613.name: Camen Miranda

1367.instructions: Mix well the Thunderbird with the Vodka and pour into an empty litre coke/lemonade bottle. The exact ratio of vodka:thunderbird can be altered to the creator's taste. Fridge for at least 12 hours. Donnington Brainstorm is best at temperatures between 2-4 degrees centigrade. If the drink is too cold it will tend to be too bitter, if it is too warm, it will tend to be too sweet. At just the right temperature, it should be light, refreshing, slightly peary and the alcohol taste minimal. Drink (with friends) VERY CAREFULLY.....
1367.name: Donnington Brainstorm

1245.instructions: Give yourself a break, use ice.
1245.name: Truck Punch

1262.instructions: Simply make a standard vodka and tonic and garnish liberally with sliced cucumbers. sounds funny, but makes a great hot weather drink.
1262.name: Pamela

1469.instructions: Blend Vodka, Kahlua, Bailey's, ice-cream and the Oreo well in a blender. Pour into a large frosted glass. Garnish with whipped cream and a cherry.
1469.name: Oreo Mudslide

1284.instructions: Pour the lager first then add the blackcurrant cordial. Top up with the cider. The colour sholud be very dark approaching the colour of Guiness.
1284.name: Diesel

1664.instructions: Fill Collins Class with Ice. Add all the white alcohol. Add the sour mix. Top off glass with Razzmatazz or Chambourd. Then shake to mix contents. A fruity version of a Long Island Iced Tea
1664.name: Grateful Dead #1

1292.instructions: Pour all the ingedients in mixing glass with ice. Shake and strain into shot glass(es).
1292.name: Red Death #2

1437.instructions: Mix ingredients into a punch bowl.
1437.name: Lynchburg Lemonade

1358.instructions: Shake the spirits with ice and strain into a Highball. Fill with Grape Tonic and stir gently. Serve with a Lemon Slice on the Rim and a Straw. If you find the Grape Tonic too sweet, add a splash or two of Lemon Juice or Sour Mix. A Sour Bank is made in an Old Fashioned with two ice cubes and Grape Fruit Juice instead. A Southern Bank is a South Bank which has been added 1 part Southern Comfort.
1358.name: South Bank

1689.instructions: Pour Vodka and Gin over ice, add Tonic and Stir
1689.name: AT&T

1529.instructions: Shake and pour into a v-shape, and garnish with cinammon.
1529.name: Friar Tuck

1647.instructions: Mix all ingredients over ice in large Shaker. Add more juice to taste for the lightweights. Shake well and strain into shot glass. This recipe may be doubled or quadrupled. We strongly encourage this. Enjoy!!
1647.name: Hurricane Hugo

1241.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
1241.name: Sunny Holiday Punch

1539.instructions: first of all pour in a glass vermouth,gin,whisky. next add the beer and last curacao and vodka's drops
1539.name: Jamaican Beer

1669.instructions: put them them in a glass... and slam it to tha head.
1669.name: 3 Wise Men

1479.instructions: build contents into a shot glass guaranteed night-ender for 21st birthday outings! (invented @ 901 Club, Los Angeles)
1479.name: Prarie Dog

1420.instructions: Pour the Coca-Cola into a highball glass. Then add the Amaretto. Finish off with one ice cube so the carbination does not leave the beverage
1420.name: Meister Mind Meld

1360.instructions: Mix ingredients in boston shaker with cracked ice. In a highball glass or champagne flute (optional), fill glass three quarters full with ice. Pour one tablespoon of cherry juice in glass before pouring in mixed ingredients. Garnish with two maraschino cherries and lemon wedge. Drink through a straw.
1360.name: Midori Sour Ultra

1374.instructions: Fill the shot glass about 3/4 full with Amaretto and top it off with enough 151 to make it burn. Put the shot glass in another glass and fill the new glass with beer (right up to the level of the shot glass). Light the Amaretto/151 and let it burn awhile. Blow it out (or leave it burning if you're brave) and slam it. Tastes just like Dr. Pepper.
1374.name: Flaming Dr. Pepper #2

1425.instructions: This is a great drink to serve on Halloween. First, pour the peach schnapps. Then, slowly pour the Irish Cream. Do not mix! The Creme will clump together and settle at the bottom of the schnapps. It will have the appearance of an internal organ!! Pour the grenadine over the Creme for a completely disgusting looking, yet thoroughly tasty party drink!
1425.name: Brain Hemmorage

1240.instructions: Put the sherbet in a bowl and pour the 7-up over the sherbet. Stir until the sherbet is melted. This makes a pretty pink punch. You can use diet soda for a punch that is less sweet.
1240.name: Strawberry Punch #2

1458.instructions: Layer Kahlua, Creme de Cacao & Bailey's. Can be made in Shot glass, test tube, or tumbler - I sometimes use a wine glass.
1458.name: Rattlesnake

1303.instructions: Fill shot class with rum, Float Tabasco Sauce on top, Drink
1303.name: Prairie Fire #1

1471.instructions: Chill martini glass. Mix equal parts stoli and Cointreau. Chill and strain. Garnish with orange slice.
1471.name: Marvellaid

1386.instructions: Layer the Kahlua, Sambucca and Grand Marnier into a shot glas in that order. Better than B-52
1386.name: B-53

1511.instructions: Pour into an 8 oz. glass and stir. Then pour into another 8 oz. glass over ice.
1511.name: Mexican Virgin

1307.instructions: Just put it together, fill with orange juice, add ice and drink it.
1307.name: Jolly Jumper

1554.instructions: Mix and serv with crushed ice
1554.name: Christer Petterson

1274.instructions: Layer the Kahlua, Amaretto, and Irish Cream into a shot glass in that order. After drinking, notice the Vapor Trails.
1274.name: B-52 #1

1610.instructions: in a glass 1/2 full of ice,mix one shot lime vodka, one shot apricot brandy and fill the rest with half sweet and sour and half 7-up. (sorry no fancy glass, we usually get it in the standard plastic cups!!)
1610.name: Swamp Water

1435.instructions: Mix everything in a glass with ice.
1435.name: Fjellbekk (Mountain Stream)

1492.instructions: Serve in a tall glass over ice. Garnich with a cherry and orange slice
1492.name: Something Peachie #2

1296.instructions: Pour jack daniels into large glass filled with ice. Pour Coca-Cola into glass. Stir lightly.
1296.name: Jack & Coke

1418.instructions: Mix in a shaker half filled with ice. Strain into a pony glass
1418.name: Southern Pink Flamingo

1443.instructions: Pour over ice in a shaker. Shake well. Strain. would be very smart to split this drink at least 2 ways...maybe three.
1443.name: Three Wise Men #2

1246.instructions: Heat the water to boiling. Cut the lemons and oranges (and lime if using) in half and squeeze the juice into a separate bowl to save, throw the skins and pulp into the boiling water. Add spices and simmer for one hour. Remove the cinnamon sticks and a few cloves and allspice and save to one side. Using a slotted spoon or strainer remove the citrus peels and pulp and the remaining spices. Return the cinnamon sticks and saved spices to the water. Add the apple juice or cider and return to heat. When boiling remove from heat and add the citrus juice and sugar. Simmer very lightly for another 10 minutes and serve. Delicious!
1246.name: Wassail #1

1522.instructions: Line up three shot glasses. Pour 1 shot of vodka into each glass. Add a splash of midori to one, a splash of orange juice to another and a splash of cranberry juice to the third. Drink them down Red, Yellow, Green. It's a stop light!
1522.name: Stop Light

1540.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a tall glass with ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.
1540.name: Beeaauu's Rum and Coke

1304.instructions: Put a small measure of each ingredient into a shot glass, not completely filling it. Lick the palm of your hand and ignite the drink. Immediately put your hand over the glass. The flames will go out and there will be a vacuum holding the glass to your hand. Take the glass and hand up to your mouth. Take off your hand and deeply inhale the fumes and then knock the drink back.
1304.name: Gray Hound

1537.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a hurricane glass with ice. Shake Vigrously Serve with a cherry and orange slice for garinsh.
1537.name: Danny Q's Aruba Rum Punch

1710.instructions: Take 1 part Vodka and shake well with 1 part of Best beer you know.
1710.name: Marvellaid

1668.instructions: Fill 12 oz. glass with ice. Add all the alcohol and sour mix. Top off glass with pineapple juice to taste then watch out.
1668.name: Pineapple Tea

1616.instructions: Mix one after the other then shake and top with whip cream
1616.name: Orange Climax

1577.instructions: Pour all the shit together, and hope it don't explode! Drink as fast as you can, with no food, and say your prayers.
1577.name: The Beavis

1439.instructions: Add ingredients to shaker with ice, shake, strain, and serve.
1439.name: Cranberry Zamboni

1489.instructions: Put Vodka in glass fill with iced tea. Stir in lemon to taste.
1489.name: Ice Pick #1

1411.instructions: Put the liquor in a tall glass, add a few drops of lime. Fill up the glass with 7-up so it suits you.
1411.name: Ragnar #1

1279.instructions: Mix fifth of a gallon of bacardi to a splash of cranberry juice Enjoy!
1279.name: The Shearer Special

1648.instructions: Put pineapple in the blender and blend (duh) till smooth. Add vodka, rum, and enough ice to raise the level to five cups. Blend until the ice gets all smashed up. Pour into tall glasses, garnish with the cherry. Drink until YOU get all smashed up.
1648.name: L&C

1480.instructions: Blend all ingredients in blender and serve in Highball glass. Decorate with a Marashino chery and a grapefruit slice
1480.name: Ariel's Frappe Punch

1259.instructions: Pour fruit punch and ice into a glass, add southern comfort, peppermint schnapps and vodka. Stir. Finish with lime juice.
1259.name: Alabama Riot

1412.instructions: Pour the ingredients in a big glass and your done. Shake it don't stir.
1412.name: Hangover

1477.instructions: Put all ingredients in blender with ice. Puree until smooth.
1477.name: Velvet Hammer #2

1639.instructions: Combine the vermouth, whiskey, bitters and ice in a mixing glass. Stir gently, don't bruise the spirits and cloud the drink. Place the cherry in a chilled cocktail glass and strain the whiskey mixture over the cherry. Rub the cut edge of the orange peel over the rim of the glass and twist it over the drink to release the oils but don't drop it in.
1639.name: Manhattan

1306.instructions: Make a plain old screwdriver, but add Coca-Cola.
1306.name: Power screwdriver

1579.instructions: Mix and server over ice with a slice of orange
1579.name: North Polar

1581.instructions: Fill and stir, they love the name.
1581.name: Cramit

1505.instructions: Mix amaretto and grand marnier in a brandy snifter or glass. Add hot tea to taste.
1505.name: Blueberry Tea

1380.instructions: Layer equal parts in the order given. This is the ONLY way to make a B-52
1380.name: B-52 #2

1347.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a highball glass with ice and enjoy.
1347.name: Moscow Mule

1542.instructions: Have it all in a shaker, add 50/50 Fanta orange/Lemon mix. Sahake. Serv in highball glass. garnish with lemon an cherry.
1542.name: Pjolter Bay

1696.instructions: Mix all liquors and sweet and sour and top off with Pepsi Cola. Stir and Serve with a Lemon wheel.
1696.name: Long Island Iced Tea #4

1678.instructions: Pour first three ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Fill with orange or pinapple juice, stir well, and serve.
1678.name: Fat Hooker

1299.instructions: This is the drink the Reptile is based on, created by Joe Schaftall. Shake indredents with cruched ice untill outside of shaker is cold enough to have water droplets on the outside. Strain into highball glass.
1299.name: Reptile (Orginal)

1309.instructions: Mix all contents in a highball glass and sitr gently. Add dash of Coca-Cola for the coloring and garnish with lemon or lime twist.
1309.name: Long Island Iced Tea #1

1369.instructions: Mix in a shaker, add some ice and shake very well
1369.name: Alexandra

1451.instructions: Pour it in a highball glass. Should be severed Cold. Also use Ice if preffered. Realy the same as an Fire Engine.
1451.name: Fire Engine With Alarm

1591.instructions: Just pour and drink. No chill.
1591.name: Peanut Butter and Jelly

1222.instructions: Chill pineapple juice and soda. Blend first four ingredients in a blender until creamy. (I've found a hand blender works very well since my blender won't hold all of this liquid or you could split it into two batches.) This can be done ahead of time and put back into the fridge until serving time. When your ready to serve, place coconut mixture in punch bowl, add ice-cream and allow it to dissolve somewhat. When ice-cream has dissolved almost completely, add pineapple soda. Add ice ring and decorate the frothy top of the punch with thin orange slices. If you wanted to make this alcoholic, cut back a little on the amount of soda and add a bit of rum - I like it with Captain Morgan's Spiced Rum.
1222.name: Pina Colada Punch

1704.instructions: Mix irish whiskey, irish cream, and ice cubes. Shake to chill. Serve with or without the ice, it is very good either way.
1704.name: Dublin Doubler

1385.instructions: Put in large container (fu-cha bottle) with ice and shake vigorously. Drink rapidly. Buckets on hand would be advisable.
1385.name: Fu-Cha

1239.instructions: Allow strawberries to thaw for a couple of hours in fridge. Prepare lemonade and chill. Combine all just before serving and mix until sherbet is dissolved. Place ice ring in to keep punch cold.
1239.name: Strawberry Punch #1

1641.instructions: Combine all alchohol in 12 Oz. glass with ice. Add Sour Mix. Splash Cranberry Juice. Enough to form a layer of red at the top of the glass. Top with foam from draft beer tap.
1641.name: The Extinguisher

1404.instructions: Pour the Sambuca into a shotglass, then layer the Bailey's over by pouring it over the back of a spoon.
1404.name: Kamel Drivare

1337.instructions: Stir, pour into plastic cup and chug!!!!
1337.name: The Saint Lawrence

1438.instructions: 1. Pour the Creme de Cacao and Amaretto into a shot glass. 2. Float enough Bailey's on top to cover the shot. 3. Drop a few drops of grenadine into the shot. It looks just like a jellyfish!
1438.name: Jellyfish

1457.instructions: Mix the Crystal Light then add your favorite brand of Vodka. Pour over ice. Serve.--A nice strong party punch with almost no taste of alcohol!
1457.name: Pink Panther #1

1531.instructions: In a champagne flute with ice, add kahlua and top with milk. Stir. Garnish stirrer, nutmeg.
1531.name: Brown cow

1572.instructions: pour ingredients into blender over crushed ice blend until you see the top of the mix stop moving pour into margarita glass and garnish with a lemon or lime slice... (by the way, this makes 1 to 2 servings only) hope ya enjoy it...
1572.name: Titty Twister-Rita

1514.instructions: measure all ingredients into a shot glass and drink
1514.name: Mudslide #2

1344.instructions: Drop shot glass of s.c. into lowball glass mixed with 7-UP and grenadine. Slam it!!!
1344.name: Blood Clot #1

1636.instructions: In a beer mug large enough to hold a shot glass, mix beer and O.J. Drop in shot of Amaretto (depth charge) and slam.

1297.instructions: Put a few cubes of ice inside glass. Pour shot of Seagram 7 into the glass, then Pour 7-UP into glass. Shake or stir briskly.
1297.name: Seven and Seven

1507.instructions: Fill a cocktail glass with ice. Layer ingredients. Do not stir.
1507.name: Killer Kool-Aid

1697.instructions: Add all ingredients to blender including one mint leaf as it will be blended up and leave little specks at top of drink. After drink is complete add other whole mint leaves. A lime wedge can also be added. Amount of soda water should fluxuate according to how strong the lemon-lime solution is.
1697.name: South Side

1549.instructions: Fill a highball glass with 1 part Pisang Ambon. Pour 2 parts sprite in glas. then add some lime. Remember some ice-cubes. Drink with straw.
1549.name: Green Frog

1462.instructions: Combine the George Dickel, Jack Daniels, and Jim Beam into a 2 ounce shot glass. Splash in the grenadine. Give a quick stir-spin with a straw or stir rod. Slam fast and hard. Exhale.
1462.name: Burning Cherry

1481.instructions: Just throw them all together add some ice and drink. If you can't get Tahiti Treat use pineapple juice

1291.instructions: Bend smooth. Serve in a frozen mug.
1291.name: Blue iguana

1395.instructions: Obviously this is not a drink for a small glass. Shake with ice. Strain the mixture into a tall glass. Garnish with a cherry if you feel so inclined.
1395.name: Caribbean Screwdriver

1527.instructions: Into an old fashion glass, pour vodka over ice. Add pickled pepper, and stir around with its stem. Devour pepper after draining drink.
1527.name: Green Monster

1267.instructions: Mix in a lowball glass and serve over ice
1267.name: Carribean pineapple

1615.instructions: Shaken and strained through ice !!! Mmmmm.....
1615.name: Broken down golf cart

1393.instructions: Pour all ingredients in a cocktail shaker, filled with ice. Shake and strain into a cocktail glass.
1393.name: Rum Runner by Charles

1517.instructions: Put them in a glass, Pray to God, Then slam it!!!
1517.name: Brutal Hammer

1391.instructions: layered- bottom to top Kahlua, Bailey's, Canadian Club
1391.name: Duck Fart

1671.instructions: The amount of ingredients can vary depending upon the size of the punch bowl,
1671.name: The Breakfast Drink

1598.instructions: Combine everything together in order it is listed, you may add Kool-Aid mix if desired, but make sure to add the lemon juice last. It is called an Arif because it will tend to block your nuts from getting off if you have too many of these.
1598.name: An Arif

1417.instructions: Layer in a 2 oz shot glass or pony glass
1417.name: Bob Marley

1509.instructions: Poor the Koskenkorva Peach in a glas, fill up with Coca-Cola and stir. To be served cold, but without ice.
1509.name: Peach 200

1242.instructions: Combine wine, lemon rind, and juice. Stir in 1 cup of the sugar and let stand until sugar dissolves. Combine milk and cream, add wine mixture, and beat with a rotary beater until frothy. Beat egg whites until stiff, add remaining 1/2 cup sugar, a little at a time, beating constantly until whites stand in peaks. Pour wine mixture into punch bowl, top with puffs of egg white, and sprinkle whites with nutmeg.

1265.instructions: In a strainer add all three ingredients. Fill half full of ice. Shake well. Strain into a double shot glass.
1265.name: Pecker Head

1379.instructions: Pour vodka over ice, add kahlua and irish cream. Stir add 1 to 3 filbert nut(s).

1442.instructions: In a tall mixing glass with ice pour the vodka on the bottom. Then fill the glass 3/4 full with sour mix. Pour in the rest of the ingredients one at a time. Garnish with pineapple spear and cherry
1442.name: Beetlejuice

1398.instructions: Pour all the alcoholic ingredients in a highball glass, Stir Sour mix in a mixer and fill the glass.
1398.name: Yellow Bird

1638.instructions: Pour Creme de cassis in glass, gently pour champagne on top
1638.name: Kir Royale

1706.instructions: Just like making a milk shake, but add the Kahlua. This drink is very rich, but it tastes great. We invented it one summer day!!
1706.name: Kahlua Fudge Shake

1568.instructions: Fill up shot glass with 151 proof Rum. Then add a dash of Tabasco into the glass. Allow a few seconds to settle. Drink fast and stand back.
1568.name: Fire in Heaven

1362.instructions: Squeeze juice from a fresh lemon. Mix with Koskenkorva.
1362.name: Peltikatto

1663.instructions: Mix Vodka and Juice in a any kind of bottle.
1663.name: Aranov

1713.instructions: Stir together and serve over ice
1713.name: Screaming Orgasm II

1294.instructions: Pour Jager into triple shot glass. Add Perpermint schnaups then Goldshlager. Top with Malibu.
1294.name: Motor Oil

1430.instructions: Layer Bailey's First ,milk, Creme de Menthe and Cinnamon Schnapps.
1430.name: Eskimo Joe

1266.instructions: In a shaker mix Vodka, Kahlua, and milk. Pour into a rocks glass and add a splash of Coca-Cola
1266.name: Colorado Bulldog

1596.instructions: Pour cold beer into a large glass, and drop whole shot glass full of vodka into beer. Guzzle as fast as you can, and let out a roar, a REAL man.
1596.name: Russian Boilermaker

1409.instructions: Just mix the ingredients and enjoy it.
1409.name: Long Island

1467.instructions: Dip the rim of a cocktail glass in Kahlua, then in brown sugar. Shake the spirits and cream with ice, strain into the frosted glass and sprinkle cinnamon on top. This drink is created by Sami Taalas Caribbean Kiss won Trois Rivieres After Dinner Cocktail Competition Swedish Championship 1994
1467.name: Caribbean Kiss

1525.instructions: Fill blender 3/4 with ice (small cubes best). Add a small splash of vodka, a small splash of Grand Marnier. Add a healthy serving of kahlua and a little less healthy splash of amarreto. Fill the blender with Bailey's until liquid is 1/2 inch from top of icecubes. Mix until smooth. Pour in hurricane glass and sprinkle some nutmeg on top! (Sorry about the vagueness. I learned this recipe while bartending in the Virgin Islands -- St. Thomas before it was demolished by Marylin. The drink is kick ass! The consistency should be like a milk shake, except without the milk. Also, this drink may be a bit expensive here (liquor is EXTREMELY cheap in the Caribbean)).
1525.name: Bushwacker #2

1635.instructions: Add all the shit into one large cooler or what ever you have that will hold it add one block of ice and mix then consume till it whomps you in the ASS
1635.name: Whoomp

1421.instructions: 1. Place 3 to 6 twisted or crushed fresh mint leaves into a medium sized cocktail glass 2. Add 2 to 3 shots of your favorite frozen vodka 3. Add ice if desired 4. Stir lightly
1421.name: Mint Russki, or Spearmint Ivan

1310.instructions: Mix one part of Midori (or equivalent melon liqueor) with one part of Orange Juice. Add a slash of Granadine Syrup.
1310.name: Midori Sunrise

1317.instructions: Pour into shot glass. Put in mouth. Repeat as deemed necessary.
1317.name: Damned if you do

1705.instructions: Start with sugar in the empty glass. Next pour in the whiskey, followed by the coffee. Stir till sugar is disolved, let mixture settle. Float whipped cream on top. Curl up in front of the fireplace with J. Joyce and enjoy!
1705.name: Irish Coffee (Simple)

1717.instructions: Pour one shot of Apple Juice and another of Vodka. Sprinkle cimmamon on the tougue and pour both shots into your mouth. Without drinking, shake your head until cimmamon is dissovled and drink. (Repeat if nessesary....or unconscious on the floor.)
1717.name: Apple Pie Shot #1

1637.instructions: mix ingredients in a glass and knock off those dust-bunnies
1637.name: Jamaican Dust-Buster

1526.instructions: pour rumple minze(should be pre chilled) into shot glass add jager(should also be pre chilled), serve
1526.name: Dead Nazi

1406.instructions: Combine the vodka and rum in a shot glass. Add the chartreuse to make the drink a gasoline-type color.
1406.name: Sunoco 251

1455.instructions: Fill a glass (40-50 cl) with whiskey, midori, Bailey's and then C.C. untill you have enough foam (it looks horrible). Drink it with a straw and don't look at the color :-)
1455.name: Grovschpol

1583.instructions: Pour in shot glass. Take a sniff and shoot!
1583.name: Gorilla Fart #1

1335.instructions: Pour two ounces of Yukon Jack over ice, add a dash of lime juice, enjoy
1335.name: Snakebite #1

1390.instructions: Mix 'em, garnish with a slice of lime (optional).
1390.name: Spearmint Lifesaver

1528.instructions: Fill a 12 oz wine glass with ice, add a lime wedge and transfer into shaker. Add ingredients, shake and pour back into glass. Garnish stirrer, straw, cherry-pineapple, parasol, and mint.
1528.name: Scorpion

1288.instructions: Pour Vodka in highball over ice, add soda, top of with splash of OJ (just a splash)
1288.name: Yo mama cocktail

1300.instructions: Stir ingredients and poor into a highball glass. Dance while drinking to the song Mona-Lisa with Rob'n'Raz. Oh! boy will you get drunk!
1300.name: Mona-Lisa

1340.instructions: Dump out six ounces of beer, add vodka, fill up the rest of the beer can with water, mix and let settle

1460.instructions: Because of the darkness of this particular shooter, layering is not necessary.
1460.name: Tootsie Roll

1714.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a pitcher of ice to chill, adding just enough grenadine to color pink. Add more or less OJ and 7-up to achieve desired strength. Strain into bottle to serve as shooters or serve the whole pitcher with a number of straws for a group to slurp down at the same time!!
1714.name: Sex on the Beach #3

1397.instructions: Pour in Amaretto and Whiskey in a shot glass. Top shot with Everclear. Light shot on fire Drop in glass of beer Chug!!!
1397.name: Flaming D-

1257.instructions: Measure the port into a brandy glass, the pour the Bailey's in. As the Bailey's enters the port it will solidify, forming a glob.
1257.name: Gorilla Snot #1

1680.instructions: boil water and whisky in seprate glasses, ignite whisky, slowly mix whisky and water 4-6 times
1680.name: Blue Blazer

1594.instructions: Add ice cubes to a glass. Mix the ingredients.
1594.name: Vincent Vega

1606.instructions: pour over ice in rock glass
1606.name: Slippery Dick

1695.instructions: pour very cold tequila with Benedictine in a shot glass.You serve it with a slice of orange that has cinnamon on it nad kalo methisi(that was Greek)
1695.name: John's Bomb

1532.instructions: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Stir. Caution: use only high quality vodka. Cheap vodka can cause the Bailey's to curdle. Test your brand of vodka by mixing 1 Tsp each of vodka and Bailey's first.
1532.name: Screaming Orgasm

1403.instructions: Same as Harvey Wallbanger. (Yes, it is MILK!! Believe it or not, it doesn't taste that bad) Say hello to Jan Henning, will you?
1403.name: Harvey Cowpuncher

1356.instructions: Mix it in a glass 1/4 full of ice...
1356.name: Piggelin #1

1715.instructions: Keep bottles chilled or mix over ice and strain into shot glass.
1715.name: Burning Nazi

1237.instructions: Sprinkle strawbs with sugar, add one bottle cider. Chill for several hours. To serve, pour into large bowl with ice, add the rest of the wine. Serve in small wine glasses.
1237.name: Strawberry Bolle

1325.instructions: Serve in rocks glass - no ice - Pour both liquors, fill with club soda, roll once Serve with straw
1325.name: Southampton Slam

1709.instructions: By adding the steamed milk last, the ingredients mix well. Make sure to stir all of the chocolate from the bottom of glass.
1709.name: Mocha Mint Irish Cream Cappuccino

1234.instructions: Mix the cognac and curacao several hours ahead of time. When ready to serve, pour the necessary amount of this mixture over a block of ice or ice mold in a *cold* punch bowl, and add *thoroughly chilled* champagne. Stir and serve at once, WITHOUT LADLING BACK AND FORTH OVER THE ICE, as this will eliminate the bubbles.
1234.name: Sauterne

1281.instructions: Put 3 shots of the rum in a glass, fill the rest of the cup with the juice.
1281.name: Malibu juice

1238.instructions: Throw everything into a blender and mix until fairly smooth. Serve over ice.
1238.name: Strawberry Lemonade

1599.instructions: Shake gently and pour over ice in old fashioned glass.
1599.name: Kiltlifter

1687.instructions: Add tequila and chilled 7-UP to glass, drop in one sweet prune in each glass. Add ice if you wish.
1687.name: Fart In the Ocean

1702.instructions: Put all contents in a blender and blend until smooth. Ice-cream can be substituted for the half-and-half
1702.name: Bushwacker #3

1227.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl.
1227.name: Purple Jesus

1475.instructions: serve in a tall glass over ice garnish with a cherry and orange
1475.name: Something Peachie #1

1564.instructions: Mix all ingredients and pour over ice. Wonderful smooth tasting drink. But watch out it will knock your socks off!
1564.name: Texas Rose

1619.instructions: Lightly rub the rim of a cocktail glass with some lime juice, dip glass rim in the salt. Mix all ingredients with ice, strain into fresh ice in the salt-rimmed glass, and enjoy!
1619.name: JimPop's Margarita

1459.instructions: Pour alcohol over ice cubes in tall glass. Add lime juice and Sprite / 7-UP. Stir well.
1459.name: Veterinary

1626.instructions: measure light and dark rum into glass, add juices, grenadine...shake well, top with 151 rum... garnish with cherry and orange slice.
1626.name: Harlee's Planters Punch

1544.instructions: Mix the 5 whites and 2 whiskies in a beer mug in equal amounts. Top up the rest of the mug with half beer and half stout.
1544.name: Graveyard

1560.instructions: Combine in a mixing glass, stir gently and pour over ice cubes in a highball glass
1560.name: Brown Pelican

1493.instructions: Mix this and add orange peel.
1493.name: Maueek

1590.instructions: Combine ingredients in shaker over ice and chill. Strain and pour in shot glass.
1590.name: Rocky Mountain Mother Fucker

1503.instructions: Hand shake or blend with ice the liquer with the sour. Strain the drink from the ice into a pounder glass. Float Blue Curacao before serving
1503.name: Alien Urine Sample

1275.instructions: Over ice add 151 and amaretto. Top off with pineapple juice.
1275.name: Wahoo

1286.instructions: Dump the ingredients into a container and stir it. It's very simple and very delicious.
1286.name: Dogg piss

1473.instructions: In a shaker full of cracked ice, combine Campari and lemon juice. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Heat brandy in a chaffing dish. When warm, ignite the brandy and pour in a flaming stream into the cocktail glass.
